reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2023
review_body:
Afnan 9PM is honestly one of the top colognes in my collection. The smell is very sweet and opens quite fresh, juicy, elegant and sugary, but it dries down very warm and ambery with a huge dose of vanilla.
I have smelt the real deal(JPG Ultra Male) and I prefer Afnan 9PM. Many people won‚Äôt say this but Afnan 9PM is SWEETER, and does seem to be stronger too! Jean Paul‚Äôs Ultra Male is more masculine and heavy but the Scent of Afnan 9PM isn‚Äôt super feminine.
Performance is decent, I have got the super duper longevity people talk about, but the projection in the beginning is INSANE.
Is it worth it? It‚Äôd say so yeah. Way better than my Club De Nuit Intense Man(CDNIM) EDT Aventus clone.

It came a day earlier than it said it was going to!!! The smell is very bubble gum powder but masculine and not in an overpowering or bad way. It‚Äôs an easy wear. I don‚Äôt have to worry about it giving me a headache. Also even though it has a candy smell it‚Äôs not too sweet. Buy it unless you don‚Äôt want to smell good and then don‚Äôt!! Lol üòù

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2023
review_body:
I recently had the pleasure of trying out the Afnan 9pm for Men fragrance due to all the hype of TikTok. As a current Tom Ford user, I am a big fan of spicy luxurious scents. I am quite satisfied with the cologne overall. First and foremost, the unboxing experience felt very classy. The sleek, black bottle with its magnetic cap not only looks elegant on my dresser but allows it to fit in with my other more high-end colognes.
Now, let's talk about the fragrance itself. The initial top notes of citrus, bergamot, and blackcurrant are invigorating and refreshing, always earning me compliments.
Now as much as I want to continue saying positive things regarding the cologne, I must say I was a little disappointed by the longevity. For the first few hours, it is definitely noticeable but despite what others say, I feel as though it tapers off HARD rather fast after that. By the afternoon, unless someone is essentially hugging me, they will not smell the Afnan. It is definitely a great casual fragrance, though! The versatility of the cologne is something that I greatly appreciate. While it works wonderfully as a sophisticated evening scent, it is also suitable for daytime wear, adding an air of confidence and elegance to any outfit. Whether I'm at the office, attending a formal event, or spending a casual day out with friends, this fragrance feels appropriate for any occasion.
If you are looking for a good daily cologne or something with an unbeatable bang for buck, I would say buy Afnan 9pm!

review_body:
Wow, I‚Äôm always weary of buying colognes on Amazon, but this is 100% real! The cologne box has a Afnon hologram on the side for authenticity.

The smell of this is amazing! Smells like Ultra Male, but better and stronger! I‚Äôve had it on for a few hours after receiving it and I can smell myself non stop. Big whafs of vanilla, cardamom, and a sweet apple and lavender. It‚Äôs super sweet, but not overly sweet. It‚Äôs still masculine. I will be buying again. reviewer_title: Too good Cant wait to buy more!
review_body:
Sure, here is a review of Afnan 9pm for Men Eau de Parfum Spray, 3.4 Ounce:

Afnan 9pm is a popular fragrance for men that is often compared to Jean Paul Gaultier Ultra Male. It is a sweet, fruity fragrance with notes of apple, cinnamon, lavender, and bergamot. The heart notes are orange blossom and lily of the valley, and the base notes are vanilla, tonka bean, amber, and patchouli.

Afnan 9pm is a great choice for a night out. It is long-lasting and has a moderate projection. It is also relatively affordable, making it a great value for the price.

Here are some of the pros and cons of Afnan 9pm:

Pros:

Long-lasting
Moderate projection
Affordable
Sweet, fruity scent
Great for night outs
Cons:

Can be too sweet for some people
Not as unique as some other fragrances
Overall, I think Afnan 9pm is a great fragrance. It is well-made, long-lasting, and affordable. I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a new fragrance.

reviewer_title: Great buy, very similar to JPG Ultra Male
review_body: Pretty spot on to Ultra Male. Opens up slightly more harsher and synthetic and "sharp" in its sweetness, but a bit brighter too. It's also apple rather than pear but that doesn't really make a huge difference. The dry down is beautiful and a bit more base notes compared to ultra male, which keeps it's top notes for most of it's duration. The projection is great in it's opening and decent during the rest of it, not as strong as UM. It also does not have the same longevity and turns into a skin note maybe 6 hours in. But it's a great cheap buy IMO.

review_body: So I bought this blindly because it had amazing reviews, I really had high hopes for it. And my parents were flat out offended by the smell. I really have no idea why it has such amazing reviews. It does last forever, unlike most female perfumes. Everyone, literally EVERYONE I encountered told me to never wear this again. I even sprayed it in the air (to make sure it wasn‚Äôt just the way it was reacting with my body chemistry) for my roommates to smell. And they immediately cracked the windows and sprayed Febreze. This smells like somebody sprayed White Diamonds on a sewage plant. It‚Äôs a headache and a bottle. I wanted to like this so bad, but nobody around me liked me with it on.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2022
review_body:
This perfume is definitely for an acquired taste.

First, the good: Nice presentation; the box and bottle are of high quality, or seem that way. The scent is quite strong, sillage is moderate (people would have to be within arms length of me before they can sense it). Longevity on me is ridiculous; more than 12 hours for sure! The price for the quality is fantastic!

The not so good (maybe): This perfume is definitely not for everyone. At the open, it smells of burning wood (not in a good way). I'm a big fan of incense and frankincense, but this one is quite off putting for me in the beginning. The dry down is much better; it settles into a sweeter incense sort of smell akin to an Oriental incense fragrance. Most others who smelled it on me were not a fan.

Verdict: Have you ever been near an open fire of wood? You know that smokey smell that stays on your clothes afterwards? Did you like that smell? Yes? Then this is for you! No? Stay far away!

That mid and dry down is worth enduring the opening. The mid is sweet n smoky, the dry down is leather n oud.

review_body:
I bought this due to all the hype around it. Since fragrance is very subjective it could be a scent profile you like, but personally I hate it!
It has a strong herbal note and the incense seems very synthetic. I was excited to try this because it‚Äôs supposed to be a clone of interlude but for me it‚Äôs a hard miss.
Maybe I got a bad batch but I will never wear this, I‚Äôll try to find someone who likes it and give it to them as I can‚Äôt return it for whatever reason. It was a waste of money for me, the scent does last a long time though which isn‚Äôt good if you don‚Äôt like it

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2022
reviewer_title: Very good scent, Great price, not for everyone
review_body: I bought this because it is a clone of amouage interlude man but waaaay cheaper price. This does not smell cheap, their are quality ingredients but I dont think this scent is for the casual person. It smells like incense and a clean fun kind of smell. In my head it makes me imagine it smells like a brand new music studio with dimmed lights with kind of a hippie theme going on and they have insense burning but also drinking juice. It also gives off mad cornerstore vibes but better. for the price if you are frag collector this is worth buying because it is different

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2022
reviewer_title: Wow, I dunno about this one...
review_body: Their Supremacy Silver is an awesome scent, I wear it regularly. This stuff...I've never smelled the fragrance this is supposedly imitating, but, ew. I knew it was supposed to be an incense heavy fragrance, what I didn't expect was for it to smell just like my old wooden incense burning box, when it's cold and overflowing with the stale ashes of incense past. I have only tried it on paper thus far, so perhaps it undergoes a fantastic change on skin... I will try it out the next time I don't need to leave the house for a while. For my initial impression based on the opening and dry down on paper, I'm not a fan. I hate to say it because they make some really good fragrances, this one may simply not be for me. I will update this if my mind changes.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2022
reviewer_title: A spicy treat that's perfect for fall and winter
review_body:
It is very dense and smoky in the open. That incense jumps out but is alluring. The scent trail retains the sweeter notes but anything close to skin gets a strong incense feeling. The mid is where the spices settle, Leather, Labdunum and Amber emerge to smooth out the edges.

This phase makes this scent shine. The mid's longevity is insane and the drydown is fantastic. It's a mature, mysterious scent that pulls you in. I love this scent. It will likely take a place high in my winter fragrances.

Update: It grows on you. Currently rocking during mid-winter and it's my favorite cold weather scent. It's complexity is soothing and the price is alright with me.

review_body: Well at first I thought this would be some low budget Knock off fake of the real one or even a watered down version, because it is a 5 oz bottle. But it is true..Afnan has cloned Aventus very nicely here and this is a very long lasting scent, easily over 5 hours of you wanted..plus the 5 oz bottle is just great in terms of price. May disagree but I'm telling you the truth and I hate writing and I just said to my self let me write this to help out other guys who may have questioned it like me...that's all. It came package well and in thier beautiful bottle design that is very familiar if you have had any of thier other fragrances. Ok üëçüèº good luck on your buy. This is definitely for someone that wants to smell like they take care of their hygiene, and smell like it for a good few hours. It has longevity but I‚Äôm bad at judging it because I lose the ability to smell something when I‚Äôm immersed in it, yet I can tell this sticks around longer than most of my other scents. Will definitely continue buying this.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2023
review_body: used this product for many years, my wife likes the scent

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2009
review_body:
I recently wanted to expand beyond my old and paltry collection of Drakkar, Georgio RSVP (yes, I lived in the 80's), and Kenneth Cole RSVP. So I bought the sampler of CK from Amazon (Obsession, Eternity, CK One, IN2U, and Euphoria). Euphoria was my favorite, IN2U was OK, and the other two made my eyes water for hours. I then buckled down and got full size bottles of Versace Pour Homme, Cool Water, Alfred Sung, Versace Dreamer, and Very Irresistible.

Dreamer and Very Irresistible smell almost like clones of each other. Versace for Men and Euphoria, are also pretty close, although Versace is much cleaner and more complex. Cool water is nice. That's it. It is nice. Good for business or a night out with your sister. The rest of the CK line is too common. That leaves Sung. This is by far THE most unique scent I purchased. It doesn't smell remotely like any of these others. It has the smell of aged oak that is freshly cut. It's THAT woodsy. And it doesn't smell artificial. Two spritzes on my neck and one inside each elbow and I'm good to go for 4-6 hours. I'm afraid to try it on my clothes in fear that it will get on my coat, and fight with other scents when I decide to wear something else.

If you want a true "woodsy" scent in your collection, that has NO sweetness, but isn't a slap in the face either, then pick up this older, affordable scent. Even though it's an older scent, it stands out from others. Way out.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2019
reviewer_title: Not Quite Irish Spring, but Better!
review_body:
After doing a little bit of digging, I found out that this blue-ish version of the Alfred Sung for Men 3.4 oz is more of a recent update rather than a knockoff of the older purple-ish version like some reviewers claim.

I bought this as a complete blind buy from Amazon Services and I'm impressed with it. I can definitely see some of the comparisons to Irish Spring body wash but I would say this has a slightly spicier manly soapy scent. It's a very clean versatile scent that can be worn in just about any formal or casual occasion. The sillage is pretty good for an EDT with decent projection without being overbearing and the longevity lasts around 6+ hours before drying to more of hugger on my skin.

All-in-all, I'm very pleased and won't hesitate to pickup another bottle once this one runs out.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2023
review_body: He loves it. Smells good on him

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2023
review_body: Yes

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2018
review_body:
This is my first time wearing Sung, so I'm not sure if it's been reformulated or not, but the smell is amazing. I tend to not like modern fragrances as much, as they're so sweet and citrus-y smelling, and this cologne is definitely not that. It smells like a man's cologne. It's very strong at first; you really should let it settle in for at least a half hour before you'll be around people, as you might offend them haha. But once it starts to dry down...man, this cologne is good. It has mostly a smell of Irish Spring soap, but slightly more spice. On my skin though, after it's been on for a few hours the spice starts to fade and starts to smell slightly sweet, which is very nice.

To me, it most closely resembles Paco Rabanne, which is another one of my favorite colognes. I think I like Sung more though, as it lasts longer and has a very unique smell all throughout it's lasting time.

Highly recommended.

review_body: I usually wear Alfred Sung and I do just love it. So I thought I would try this one. I like it but not as well as my other one. But that is just me. It has more of a hint of a man‚Äôs Cologne which is not bad. Worth trying for sure!

review_body: Great scent, good price

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2019
review_body: There is a big debate over which is a better soapy Irish Spring evocative cologne: Alfred Sung or Thierry Mugler. You know, I never expected to find that I prefer Sung. Sung and Mugler are very similar at their core. However there is just something old ladyish about Mugler. It is unisex after all and a bit sweeter. But what makes the difference for me is the slight smokiness of Sung. Sung is hands down masculine. Theirry Mugler is not -- which explains its rebirth as Come Together. And what a difference in price, especially if you snag Sung in the Warehouse. As to the S-factor in Mugler. Really?!! Who knows what that is. If it's essence of old lady, I don't care for it.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2021
review_body: This is my 3rd bottle, the first from my daughter who told me she loves it on her husband. Each time I wear it, it seems that a lady will make a positive comment. I like the fact that it's not an overpowering smell. Also, I read that cologne lasts longer if kept in the refrigerator which is where I keep this.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2022
review_body: The fragrance Alfred Sung has the original formula and an updated formula and you can tell the difference in the color of the juice. The original formula is a much lighter violet and the newer formula is a very dark violet. The seller used the item image of the original formula which is deliberately misleading. The darker formula is many times weaker than the original formula. I am EXTREMELY disappointed but do not feel like dealing with the annoyance of returning it. Beware of this seller.

review_body: I like this blend. To me, the smell a pleasant balance between sweet and woody, with just enough strength and staying power to linger a bit without being overpowering. That said, you might want to apply it more than just a few seconds before you join the car pool. The price is good and the Prime delivery great. With a little less sweetness to the blend, I would give it 5 stars. That said, at this price, I will be buying again.

review_body: Love this scent. Sung is brilliant, for It is not overwhelming, nor is it citric with lime. It is like a mild perfume with a masculine twist. I prefer this in the daytime, but opt for a heaver scent in the evenings out ( like Burberry).

reviewer_title: Overall I'm pleased and the color change is NOT a deal breaker ...
review_body: I used to buy Sung by Alfred Sung years ago and it was the light purple color. The product I received thru your company has a deep blue color with a slight difference in scent. I'm ok with that since it could have changed in color due to new smellers or fragrant blenders and several years have passed since I used this product. Overall I'm pleased and the color change is NOT a deal breaker at all.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2015
review_body: Bought a $15 small bottle as a blind buy because I had heard this was close to Irish Spring. My first impression was a resounding no, and it was so bad that I almost threw it out. I've found that with this stuff, you have to go very light -- lighter than I've ever gone with any fragrance to be honest. If you apply with the lightest touch, you get a good thing going that I would describe as a blend of pine trees, tobacco, and Irish Spring. It's just okay, though it's gotten some attention. Good for an older gentleman in a tie maybe, but this really isn't my style. I'm 27, very athletic, and a working-class straight guy who prefers smelling more like a down-to-earth guy-next-door than a posh club-goer. I'm definitely into inexpensive stuff but this one's not for me. May consider wearing again in 25 years if it's still around.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2019
reviewer_title: Let's get something straight: Does NOT smell like Irish Spring
review_body:
To the people who said this smells like Irish Spring Soap, when's the last time you actually had a bath? This stuff smells like super powerful cheap cologne. I don't smell even a hint of anything resembling that classic Irish Spring Soap scent (I use the stuff every single day).

If you're looking for a scent thats a subtle, just had a shower refreshing scent, but without the obvious "he's wearing a cologne" bullseye, this isn't the scent for you.

I give it a 3/5, considering the price range (obviously compared to more expensive stuff this score would go down). If anything changes I will update the review but for now: you get (and smell like) what you pay for - cheap cologne.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2013
review_body: I used to use this cologne in the 90's when I was single and always had a good response from women. I used to even have married women ask me what it was for their husbands. After the years went by I used other scents but recently I sought this one out again and had a hard time finding it. I never thought to look on Amazon and here it was, and cheap too. I used to pay $45 or more for this same bottle in the 90's and here it is only $18! The scent still gets me the same response it did back when I was younger and single. I have had nothing but compliments from this. I was using cologne that cost $70-$80 for an ounce but not anymore!

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2017
review_body: As a 22 year old, this is a little too "old" smelling for me. I have designated it as my aftershower "clean and soapy" smell that I spray once on me. I use this when I want to smell clean and fresh, but for nothing else. It's not a sexy smell, but it is a simple, clean smell. I wouldn't ever use this as one of my pain scents that I want people to notice when I walk into the room. If you intend to use it like me, it might be worth it since it is cheap. Lomani homme lomani is a little bit better option, as it is not as soapy, and has a few more modern notes in it.

review_body: I guess I have bought this fragrance now about 4 times in 5 years.. I cant get enough of it..Though I only wear it occasionally, My wife and daughter loves the way it smells. THAT BEING SAID, What sticks out the most is the Lemon,pepper and jasmine. Dam does it smell good! It's been around since 1989..Guess that should tell you something!

reviewer_title: Ships and Sold by Amazon = COUNTERFEIT??
review_body:
Ships and Sold by Amazon = COUNTERFEIT??

Hmmm. I have been using this Cologne/Eau de Toilette since the day it came out, ~30 Years.
Loved that it was ‚ÄúShips and Sold by Amazon‚Äù, especially with Prime
This delivery was ‚Ä¶ off‚Ä¶

Before, I was glad to find the GENUINE Alfred SUNG for Men HOMME available directly from Amazon. This order (I bought two bottles) was ‚Ä¶ OFF ‚Ä¶

The Monolith block fancy integrated nozzle was the SUNG Trademark.
This order has a plastic chrome generic nozzle.

SUNG HOMME had an intense vibrant rich purple color;
This one is ‚ÄúBlue ‚Äòish‚Äù, with a tiny hint of purple.

Maybe the wholesaler who provides Amazon had a problem somewhere in the supply chain?

UNLESS Alfred SUNG personally puts out a press release that claims that after 30 Years, they redesigned their bottle nozzle design and shifted the color of the cologne/Eau d T, I am gonna have to call this one out as HIGHLY Suspect.

Amazon states: ‚ÄúThis item can‚Äôt be returned‚Äù Darn, I preferred buying ‚Äòsold by Amazon‚Äô in order to avoid counterfeits, Disappointed this one time‚Ä¶. ;(

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2008
reviewer_title: Classy stuff! Your wife, etc, will thank you for it.
review_body:
As noted by other reviewers, Pure isn't easy to find, especially at such a reasonable price -- and thank goodness for Prime shipping options!
Kudos to Amazon.
I -- and more importantly -- my wife think this is a lovely, nearly unique, but not overpowering fragrance good for wearing anytime.
I first bought it for my wife 5 or 6 years ago -- for some reason, I thought back then it was spelled Pur (no e) -- and was pleasantly surprised how much she liked it. (Everyone knows what a gamble it is for us men to buy fragrances that our women have not pre-approved!)
But if you/she haven't smelled it, I'd suggest trying to find it at your local department store and ask them for a whiff. No description you'll find in these ratings can substitute for your/her nose.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2023
reviewer_title: This use to be one of my favorites to wear
review_body: In the past I've bought this perfume because it smelled lovely. If you haven't bought this perfume before, there are 3 versions of it. The original which is a mild floral scent with just a slight gold color. The 2nd is a lightweight scent of the floral and is clear in color. The 3rd is a citrus scent, it's clear with just a slight touch of pink. In the past this perfume used to have the labels on the actual bottles to let you know the scent and the concentration level. My guess is for aesthetics and marketing they remove the labels on the bottles. The boxes all look the same with the ingredients listed on the back. They don't tell you the concentration level or the scent you're buying. You are taking a risk if you buy it online. This is a theory that I have. I believe SHI perfume is going to be discontinued. In the past three years, this perfume seems to be watered down. This perfume is classified as a Eau De Parfum or EDP which 15-25% is oil based. If you're lucky the fragrance should last 3 hours. My last few purchases the fragrance lasted 1 and half hr. Once again this is my opinion I believe That the manufacturer is using less oil-based ingredients which now classifies it as a Eau De Toilette(EDT) or Eau Fraiche (EF). Which basically has less than10% perfume oil and is mostly water. It won't even last 45 minutes. If you want to buy a fragrance that is mostly perfume oil itself whether it's plant, tree or mineral, look for a fragrance on the label that says: PARFUM as the first ingredient. It is usually 30 to 40% perfume oil, and these are the ones that can be a little expensive also remember that name brand doesn't mean quality.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2023
review_body:
Rogue 540 is absolutely wonderful! I get complements on the daily when I wear this. I‚Äôm in my mid 20‚Äôs and it does not have a grandma smell at all. (That was my fear) I feel like it has a mature musk to it but it is totally a winter or fall perfume. It doesn‚Äôt have enough floral for a summer scent.

On the other hand‚Ä¶ Satin Oak is not what I expected. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, it smells good just a lot stronger than I thought it would be for a knock off. The Oak defiantly stands out in this one whitch makes it a winter smell hands down. I would say it‚Äôs a more feminine oak smell. I found out that throughout the day it smells better.

Both perfumes lasted me all day without having to reapply it. It doesn‚Äôt smell like alcohol or baby powder like some reviews I read. Packaging way 100% amazing! Mine came in a cardboard box with packaging peanuts and secured within another packaging bag!

For the price, quality, and amount of product you get it is a great purchase!

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2023
review_body: I wanted something with the same DNA as MFK Satin Mood. I tested them both on skin at the same time and the difference was so minimal. MFK was smoothly sharper in the opening, but within about 10 minutes I could not tell the difference. I'm serious... On my skin it was that close. In performance, it lasts longer than MFK, projecting well for the first few hours and continues to remind you it's there even up to about 7 hours. I consider it to be a "gentle beast mode" fragrance that is quite classy, but may be best suited for those who already have a good collection of fragrances. It stands in a league of its own and experiencing others first will cause you to appreciate this unique blend far more. The MFK brand was not love at first sniff, but when I came back to it further in my journey, I knew it was far more special than I had realized. Baroque Satin Oud ensures I can have the same quality experience for a mere fraction of the cost of the former while not forsaking an artful blend~

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2023
review_body:
This is apparently supposed to be a dupe for MFK Satin Oud. I have not smelled the original. But when I smell this I do get hints (distantly) of burnt sugar and gourmand as in the MFK Baccarat Rouge 540 scent profile. There is certainly a relation there. The rose really jumps out most to me. The vanilla is subtle. The oud is least noticeable. The initial spray was a bit synthetic on me. It is a VERY powdery fragrance. Not a stereotypically middle eastern scent, if that‚Äôs what you‚Äôre looking for. I saw a few people say this smells like expensive dove soap and they couldn‚Äôt be more spot on. Overall, this is a pretty nice fragrance. It smells very niche, mature and sophisticated. I see me pulling this one out for special occasions or dates.

I can‚Äôt address dry down, compliments or performance yet because I just sprayed for the first time.

8/10.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2023
reviewer_title: Deep dark osmanthus scent for about 5 minutes.... Then, it's gone!
review_body:
At first spray, this is a very powerful osmanthus smell. It's not a super fresh note. It's more of a deeper, almost masculine "fragrance oil" osmanthus scent. I don't hate it. But, it's not the fresh, light, bright, apricot-y osmanthus that I was hoping for it to be.

At about 5 minutes in, it turns into a sort of generic floral scent... It's pleasant. But, it's nearly impossible to notice anything other than something totally generic white floral close to your skin. Then... about 10 min in, you have to bury your nose against your skin to smell anything at all... Then, 10-15 minutes later it's just... GONE! There is ZERO longevity. (And, this was using two very generous full sprays right onto my skin. I tested this twice. First, with one spray...then, 1 hour later two full sprays on the same spot. Under one hour later.... the scent just vanishes! If I were to do this with the real thing, I'd have to take a shower to wash the scent off it would be so over-powering and strong.)

So, is this a dupe? No. It's a VERY one note osmanthus perfume. And, it's a short lived one at that.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2022
review_body:
I absolutely love this fragrance and it indeed does legitimately smell like a babysister to "Kil"ian's GGGB!! Initially, I sprayed the fragrance and was disappointed because I got a whiff of GGGB mixed with the scent of thee terrible infamous White Diamonds. (booooo), but, as the fragrance settled I smelled the GGGB. Now I will say that the fragrance doesn't have the same "heaviness" as the actual GGGB but for the cost, it gets close enough to make my bank account and I happy. Also, the item was delivered insanely fast....I just ordered it Tuesday night (almost a day a go) and here it is Thursday afternoon and it already arrived. The package was secure and delivered way before the initial ETA. I definitely think that this fragrance is worth the buy.

P.S.-as I sniffed my arms again, I detected something in there that Kayali has in all of its fragrances.... while I have over a 100 bottles of perfume and have been obsessed with fragrance since I was 7 years old and I'm 42 now, I don't know all of the "fragrancier vocab", so, I'll say that this fragrance is light, powdery and faintly sweet smelling. Definitely let the fragrance dry down or else you will think that you've been catfished with white diamonds....lol. I'll update tomorrow to let you all know if I could still smell the fragrance from the hamper or not.

reviewer_title: Exactly like Pegasus from Parfums de Marly.
review_body:
I can't believe how accurate this fragrance is to Pegasus. It might even last longer and for what $33.00 . That's crazy good value.

Perseus Eau de Parfum 3.4 Fl Oz Unisex

This new fragrance is composed of a stimulating mixture of Bergamot and Almond that is dried in a base of Vanilla, Sandalwood and Amber.
The Perseus presents notes of lavender, jasmine, and bitter almond while resting on a deep, creamy base of sandalwood, amber, and vanilla.
The scent is suitable for day and evening wear all year round. It always makes the wearer feel utterly unique and envelops them in an atmosphere of bygone regal celebrations. It will be especially favoured by men or woman who like oriental fern scents with distinctive accords of vanilla and almond. All those who love truly high-end fragrances should try it if they are seeking a high level of originality and the best quality.
Looking for a luxury perfume that could be used for both Professional and casual reasons, it‚Äôs elegantly High contrast look and feel makes it perfectly suitable for all occasions.
Perseus is a heady fougere scent that adds a touch of Equestrian royalty to the distinct masculine

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2023
reviewer_title: Quality floral but definitely leans feminine.
review_body:
As the title suggests, this is a quality floral but in my opinion leans very much feminine. I would not recommend this to men or women looking for a masculine leaning or equally unisex scent. Still five stars because it smells great IF you like floral fragrances, specifically if you like rose being the star of the show.

I think this is suited for those aged 25 years and up and best worn in spring and summer due to its scent profile obviously. It is strong and lasting enough to wear fall and winter. It‚Äôs very strong actually lol which is always a plus in my book.

Great scent and modern but too much on the feminine side for the purpose of my purchase. Gave it away to a couple of family members and they love it so I didn‚Äôt lose anything.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2023
reviewer_title: Great scent but roses? Not so much
review_body:
The packaging is beautiful and you get a lot of product for the price. It does last all day and smells nice.

That being said, roses it is not. It's a warm vanilla-y musk with a brief after-smell of rose. So if you want to buy this wanting to smell like a literal rose, this is not for you. It doesn't have any floral notes to it, just that deepness a rose has.

If you want to smell like literal roses and don't want to pay a whole lot, Pacifica Persian Rose is amazing for that. The packaging isn't nearly as pretty and you don't get nearly as much product but the smell is undeniable.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2021
reviewer_title: I finally received my order after an extended wait. It was well worth the wait!
review_body:
I finally received my order after an extended wait. The first thing I noticed was the box.
It's odd that not many people mention the box! The box alone is a beautifully made container with a metal plate engraved with the cologne's name. Upon first spraying; It smells amazing. Same DNA as the original AH Amber Oud but smokier, thicker, and sweeter. The initial scent of vanilla gives way to cloves, cinnamon and anise. The dry down reveals smoky incense and sweet amber with subtle woodsy notes. It's a very thick frag that doesn't need too many sprays. I sprayed twice on either side of my neck on my pulse points and one on my chest under my tee shirt.
The silage is a beast and I smell it lingering while walking around my house. At the time of writing this review it's 6 PM EST. I sprayed it at 4 PM and it's as strong now as it was on the initial spray. Great longevity!
I would like to sincerely apologize to the sellers for complaining about the delay in shipping. This frag was well worth the price and the wait, and I will definitely be purchasing it again in the future!

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2022
reviewer_title: Not what I expected at all!
review_body:
I was excited to try this perfume out when I read the reviews. It came in a nice box and when I first smelled it, it reminded me of Tom Ford M√©tallique. When I first wore it, it wasn‚Äôt as strong as I had hoped. It‚Äôs longevity is relatively short. I specifically sprayed it one day to test this. I sprayed the perfume on my wrist at 6:13 am, and the smell was gone by 7:06 am. I can‚Äôt smell it on my clothes even right after I spray it either. It also smells like alcohol run when you first spray it, but it quickly fades away. Overall, I wouldn‚Äôt buy this again.

*Edit: I sprayed it on one of my pullovers and the longevity was still pretty short. I couldn‚Äôt smell it at all that entire day, but when I was about to wear it again, a couple of days later, I could smell it just fine. So, maybe spray this perfume on whatever you want to wear in advance.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2021
review_body:
I've smelled BR450EDP and BR450Extrait and bought the travel size kits in the past but I decided to go for this in an effort to save and I'm impressed it smells 90-95% like BR450Extrait (The initial note is only a little too strong but after 6 minutes of it developing on the skin it just becomes identical to BR450 Extrait) For longevity it lasts for a good 8 hours on my skin and on clothes it will last for a few days, with all that said the batch I got was good as of now Oct 2021 and I hope Al Haramain doesn't reformulate or have issues with future batches.

As of now this is worth it, my friends know I wear BR450 and they could not tell the difference.

I highly recommend and will buy more from Al Haramain if they continue this route with formula and batches.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2021
review_body: I purchased this perfume while looking for a dupe for BR 540, One of the most intoxicating and addicting smells I have ever smelled. So for anyone else going to purchase I feel like some of these things weren‚Äôt mentioned that I noticed. One of the main differences is that when you first spray this perfume you will get an alcohol smell which you do not get with BR 540, it‚Äôs not an overpowering alcohol smell but you can definitely smell it. The smell is great though I will say that. Both perfumes are spicy when you spray them, I would say that this perfume has a sharper, spicier smell in the beginning where as the spiciness in the BR 540 is more smooth and full-bodied. Unfortunately, the longevity on me just wasn‚Äôt there at all. I sprayed about three or four sprays on my wrist and when I smelled later that night, 4-5 hours later, I could smell nothing at all. But hey, for the price it is worth it!

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2021
review_body:
If you're looking for a good, cheap alternative to Baccarat Rouge 540 Extrait, then this one is VERY close. I say this as someone who is very picky/judgmental when it comes to clones/dupes. I don't consider anything a true clone unless it's at least 90% close. I'd put this around 95%.

Now, the longevity and projection on this fragrance were subpar for me. I don't have any experience with this brand, so maybe the quality control is inconsistent. I'm willing to spend more money on some niche fragrances, but I just couldn't justify paying the BR540 prices. Considering the price of this bottle, I'd say it's worth it taking a chance on this one.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2023
review_body:
I have a VERY LONG association with fragrance ever since I was 6 years old and recognized the difference between fragrances that my Mother wore. I just couldn't believe how many she owned.
I went on to follow the same path, not to mention how many hours I spent in French perfumes shops in Paris and the rest of Europe..Then one day I was in a dept store and took a whiff of MFK Baccarat 540 Extract. The card they sprayed lasted a week! And I couldn't get that scent out of my head, and nose! However the price was a bit of a block since I just couldn't justify spenin over $845. for 6.8 oz.This one on Amazon is an exact copy and at $70/2 oz is a winner! Smells the same, YET ONLY LASTS 2 hours...I bought the real MFK body lotion to see if it helps and it gets me maybe another 2 hours.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2021
review_body:
So I learned of this fragrance, Amber Oud Rouge, because I was seeking a clone to Baccarat Rouge 540.
I read and watched many reviews that said this fragrance would be largely undistinguishable from BR540. For this particular bottle, I cannot agree.

It smells like alcohol at the opening. It transitions after about 10 minutes. It moves in the direction of BR540, but has an annoying note that reminds me of burning rubber. BR540 has a much fresher opening and is sweeter and more resinous than Amber Oud Rouge.
The alcoholic opening isn‚Äôt pleasant either. I feel like it may be a quality issue, as I have other Al Haramain fragrances which are powerful and great. Perhaps I need a fresher bottle.

reviewer_title: An incredible value for the money
review_body: Al Haramain Amber Oud Rouge is a great sweet-gourmand oud that will envelope you in a warm, heavenly cloud of resinous oud wood and last you all day. It is a unisex scent, although I typically smell it more often on men. This is known to be a close parallel to MFK Baccarat Rouge 540 and while I would say that it isn't a perfect "dupe" it does get most of the scent down solid; it even has that latex smell from the saffron on drydown. Great deal for the money spent, highly recommend.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2022
reviewer_title: Absolutely no scent on fabric, paper, me or my husband. Do not blind buy it!
review_body: I have many perfumes and have never had an issue like this. There is no scent at all. I tried it on my skin, paper, fabric, my husband. I have now sprayed about 10% of the bottle in an attempt to see if anything has changed in the week that I have owned it, but still no fragrance. The box is lovely, the bottle itself is elegant, substantial and probably one of the nicest I own, but $60+ is a lot to spend for a bottle and a box despite the elegance. I wrote an email to the company asking what happened and if they could send me a sample so I could see if my bottle is "off", but I have heard nothing from them (no surprise). Had read so many reviews about how lovely the scent is and decided to blind buy it, not because it resembles a famous perfume, but because it sounded so nice. I wonder if they have a quality control issue and maybe my batch was water?? I definitely wouldn't recommend buying this unless you are in a store where you can smell the contents.....or unless you are able to return it (which Amazon doesn't allow on this product).

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2022
reviewer_title: Sent a used/damaged item and can‚Äôt return.
review_body:
I was so excited to have found a video talking about how this is a 90% clone to BR540 which I own a travel size set of.

First- the scent is lovely, not a close clone upon sniffing in air but on my skin it smells really alike. I don‚Äôt have an expert nose and smelling these blindly I‚Äôll probably say this is the BR 540.

Longevity- only wore it for one day and the staying power and sillage is pretty good. About 6 hours.

The packaging- as you can see from my photos, the item is obviously used or damaged. It‚Äôs not full as well, when I sprayed it for the first time (if it was brand new it will take couple of tries for it to spray) this one came right out. The beautiful gold is tarnished, the gold around the spritzer is coming off. I‚Äôm sad that it was a let down. I should‚Äôve checked the return or replacement policy because I can‚Äôt even exchange this for a better one. Lesson learned.

review_body:
The fragrance is almost identical to CDNIM EDP which I can only compare to as I have both in my collection.

I'd say if you have both they're nearly identical.

However, the scent is definitely a bargain considering the price point.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2023
review_body:
It does smell just like Creed. I had a bottle before. Not sure if lack of longevity is due to our noses getting used to the scent or not. My Creed bottle (stolen at a hotel by hotel staff) also seemed to not be apparent after an hour or two. This one also. I'm not sure if it's because our noses get used to the scent of it it is legit fading that fast. I tried spraying some on a shirt hanging in my closet over night. One spray and I could still smell the spot strongly if I put my nose up to the spot. But it certainly didn't project. So I think for some people the nose just get's used to the scent. Either way, for the price, you can't complain, even if you have to apply 2-3 times a day, it's a much better deal than Creed. I bought two bottles, was going to buy more but then learned colognes do expire. Hopefully they keep making this.

That said, I'm surprised Dior Savauge which I also have get's far more complements on YouTube videos than Creed. I think some of those are biased because they don't allow for the dry down. But in every video from a variety of channels, Creed loses to Dior by 4:1

I personally don‚Äôt find it very sweet on me so as a gourmand lover I tend to layer it with a sweeter vanilla fragrance. review_body: I bought this because a Tik tok creator I love & trust said it was a dupe for Casamorati Dama Bianca which I‚Äôm obsessed with. I have a sample of Dama Bianca so I compared the two on diff arms and it‚Äôs quite different. It‚Äôs far stronger than Dama Bianca (bigger sillage & longevity) and a few notes are really enhanced (not the white florals or really the vanilla, so I guess malt & kumquat?). I don‚Äôt even like it to be honest :( I feel like a fool bc I had to buy a bottle of Dama Bianca & could‚Äôve saved myself the $50 I spent on this poor imitation. It‚Äôs not a bad fragrance, it‚Äôs just not my cup of tea when I was expecting the fluffy ethereal white floral vanilla gorgeousness of Dama Bianca. If you‚Äôre after a dupe, this isn‚Äôt it.

review_body: This fragrance smells divine. Imagine a beautiful woman in a very elegant black dress and a high stilettos. Smells feminine, classy, and unique. It has a burst of tropical citrus (kumquat & lime) deepens into a beautiful violet-vanilla heart resting on a balmy vanilla-malt base. In the air I get the violets that is almost like blueberries - and on the skin I get balmy violet-vanilla and powdery florals. Again, I imagine a lady in a beautiful black dress with stilettos at a party and she says "hello" to the people around her as she strolls through the crowd with her fragrance trailing all around her. This fragrance can be worned year round and at any occasion.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2023
review_body:
Back before the turn of the century, Creed‚Äôs Green Irish Tweed was expensive. However, it was not the $500 investment that it is today.

I was the child of wealthy parents, but I‚Äôm now a more ‚Äúnormal,‚Äù budget-conscious consumer.

Long story short, this cologne is about as close as it gets. I love it and - more importantly - my wife loves it.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2022
review_body:
Tiene un olor agradable, pero no es un aroma que recomendar√≠a comprar sin antes tener la oportunidad de probarlo. Comprar a ciegas definitivamente tiene un alto riesgo de decepci√≥n debido a las grandes expectativas que generan los comentarios de algunos "perfumistas" de youtube.

Si te gusta oler a "verde" un poco apolvado entonces este es el tuyo. En mi caso me inclino m√°s por dos clases de aromas: Dulce, rico y fresco como el Eros de Versace y de notas especiadas como One Million de Paco Rabanne; ambos con buena proyecci√≥n y buen desempe√±o en la fijaci√≥n del olor.

MI EXPERIENCIA (5 atomizaciones al aplicar):
1. Proyecci√≥n muy moderada pasado los 30 minutos.
2. Longetividad en piel y ropa aproximadamente 5 horas; pasado ese tiempo lo seguir√°s percibiendo si te acercas la nar√≠z a la mu√±eca ( suponiendo que te hayas aplicado en esa zona)
3. Uso a diario en la oficina y lastimosamente no he recibido ni un solo cumplido

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2022
review_body: I've never had an occasion to smell Creed's Green Irish Tweed, which I hear this is a clone of. I have also read a lot of reviews regarding the lack of longevity. On my skin, this stuff fires up for hours! In fact, I'm finding it hard to believe this is a summer scent‚Äîwhen it's so strong in November! I like the freshness of this; and will put away until summer. But... WOW! I hope it weakens a bit by then. Next time I use it, I will reduce to only one spray. I normally wear three sprays of anything I put on. This juice rocks and I will get more in the future! Anyone interested.... my fragrantica id is "metalelf.1"

review_body: The smell is wonderful. It does not project much, but it lingers around very gently. The longevity seems to be average or a bit better. It could allways last 12 or 14 hours, but that is probably unreasonable for the composition. The top notes smell very good and do not leave anything at all to be desired. The base notes smell like a MUCH higher quality Cool Water base, but I dont think they are as deep as GIT. All in all, it's a 100% winner if you want a much higher quality Cool Water vibe, and is definitely a contender for similar to GIT.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2019
reviewer_title: The best Green Irish Tweed clone!
review_body:
Short and sweet:
Does it smell EXACTLY like Green Irish Tweed? No. Much more sweet and creamy. But of all the clones of GIT I've tried, and I've tried a LOT, this gets it the closest. Verbena Fields and Emerald Isle from Parfums Vintage have better performance, but also aren't as close to actual GIT as this.

Bottom line...if you like GIT, save up for the real deal. It's one of, if not the, most affordable Creed fragrance out there. However, if you just want to give off the impression of GIT and don't mind re-spraying every four or five hours, this far more affordable option is for you!

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2022
review_body: First off...I own GIT. Don't listen to the naysayers saying that this doesn't smell anything like Green Irish Tweed. That is false. This is a solid clone that smells probably 95% similar. The biggest difference is in the opening, but after 15min you can't tell them apart in the air. If anything, GIT is a bit smoother. This is definitely worth picking up for the price in my opinion.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2019
reviewer_title: Great Clone of Creed's Green Irish Tweed
review_body: L'Adventure Knight (LAK) is a great clone of Creed's Green Irish Tweed. I have had a bunch of GIT decants over the years and bought a half used bottle of GIT on ebay last year. To save some money, I have tried a few GIT clones, including Armaf's Tres Nuit and I wasn't really impressed. Tres Nuit is an ok clone, but it's just not constructed very well and it has a synthetic smell to me that I don't get from the genuine GIT. LAK takes this to another level. LAK is a good quality juice for the money. It really nails GIT down and doesn't have a synthetic smell to it like Tres Nuit. The opening is 99% GIT and it remains very close during the dry down. I do get a fruit almost Aventus like vibe once it gets down to the base notes after a few hours, which I don't get from GIT--but who can complain about get a little aventus vibe at the end of this frag's journey. In terms of performance, then genuine GIT has never been a strong performer for me. I get 2 hours of moderate to strong projection (maybe 3 feet if I am heavy on the trigger) for the first 2 hours. After that, the scent bubble shrink down and it becomes a skin sent for another 4 hours (I can get 6-8 longer if it's warm out). LAK gives me about the same level of performance. You're not going to get beastly performance from GIT, so don't expect it from a $35 GIT clone. For the money, you really can't complain. This is a great fragrance for the money and a 95% clone of the original.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2020
review_body:
Hey everyone. Chase86 here. I'm also Chase86 from the most popular fragrance website. You can read other information I gave in the past there, but today, I want to do everyone a favor with this fragrance. I realize that for many they just buy and go and that not everyone is super into fragrances.

First off, if all you're after is a fragrance that smells like Green Irish Tweed, then this is going to be the highest quality version of that you can find with slightly darker DNA compared to Green Irish Tweed. It's fresher actually than Green Irish Tweed and less sweet. It's more green and minty because it has tea leaf. It has all of the notes Green Irish Tweed has, but has less amounts of ambergris and more amounts of tea leaf and powder. It comes across a bit more modern. It dries down to a fresh green smell that is quite addictive. This is basically the best bang for your buck for any fragrance you can buy today. It has fantastic longevity, it smells amazing, and it's extremely affordable. This is the best fragrance basically for the $ that I've ever purchased. The quality is on par with Green Irish Tweed and most people that smell it believe it's better than Green Irish Tweed.

So, some say that this lasts less time than Green Irish Tweed or is synthetic. This is not true. The quality is essentially the same to my nose as Green Irish Tweed. It's negligible. As far as longevity, this one lasts a bit longer. It's fantastic in every regard. It's wild that this is under $35 on Amazon. Anyway, this lasts about 8-10 hours off clothes. After about 6 hours it winds down quite a bit and can only be detected close range. This is only slightly weaker than Dior Sauvage in projection and longevity. It's very close. Three to four sprays is generally enough for me to pop this one into other's noses. It's nice.

This smells extremely fresh and slightly sweet in a green way. It doesn't smell blue like Versace Dylan Blue or Bleu de Chanel. It's a green fragrance through and through. Cool Water is a waste of money at this point since this exists. It's only slightly cheaper and it smells like a deodorizer in it's current formulation compared to this. And yes, I own all fragrances I've mentioned here in full bottles mind you. Besides Parfums de Marly Herod, I don't think there's a fragrance better than this one, and Herod is 8x the price of this one if you buy from Amazon and still 3.5x more expensive if you buy from a discounter. Regardless, you can essentially wear this fragrance all year since it can cut through the cold due to its power. It's strong. It's much stronger than most fragrances out there and it somehow still maintains a natural and non-headache inducing aroma. Nice. Green Irish Tweed is essentially irrelevant to me and I still have about 3/4ths my bottle. I stopped wearing it mostly when I got this since it's better and I can easily buy as much of this as I want without breaking the bank.

To imagine the smell of this, think of the best green smelling soap while you're in the shower and then imagine that smell sticking with you as a fragrance on your body. That's basically this. This is luxury green freshness for a steal.

My girlfriend actually texted me just now stating she wants to wear this when she comes over here in about an hour. As soon as I let her smell this recently, she said it was her favorite fragrance. She said the only fragrances close are Herod and Acqua di Gio Absolu Instinct. I can essentially agree with her on that. She said it's better than Percival, Layton, Foconero, Montblanc Explorer, Dior Sauvage, Dylan Blue, Acqua di Gio Profumo, and Green Irish Tweed itself. I let her smell a bunch of things I have and she chose this one as her favorite. The thing is, it's just so affordable. It may not be an original creation, but that doesn't mean it's not a great creation. It is. And, if you truly spray it and think it's so terrible, then spray it on someone you know and smell it radiating from them. You will be amazed then. It's that good.

Even if you aren't looking for a clone of Green Irish Tweed, I still recommend you buy this one as it will go with most body chemistries. Again, it's affordable, smells amazing, and lasts a long time. It's all season too because it's darker than Green Irish Tweed. Thankfully too as I find Green Irish Tweed a bit too sweet for me, so I like the darkness this brings and enjoy the tone it sets. This is an easy signature scent if you want it to be. You can keep on buying it too without thinking about "oh I can only wear this for special occasions" ect.

Give it a try if you'd like! You may just love this one. I know I do, and will continue to. I believe I have 3-4 bottles of this one. Nice stuff!

I see a lot of people complaining about the longevity of the fragrance. That is because it is a COLOGNE. Now "Perfume" contains more aroma oils, which ranges from 15 to 30 percent of the solution, while "Colognes"
only contains 3 to 5 percent of aroma oils. So, read before you buy.

review_body: Sometimes citrus top notes turn me off, I don't want to tell the world "hey! I showered!" But the citrus top in L'Aventure is so integrated into the other facets that it all works together. It's hard to tease out individual notes, but all together it is a very elegant, sparkly scent with a downtown, masculine frame. It's clean and sophisticated with citrus zest and a smooth, urbane musk/leather/wood dimension. I can't think of an occasion it wouldn't be great to wear in. There is zero sweetness here.

I have tried layering it under CDNIM, it does mellow out the harsh, lemony opening, which doesn't bother me, so that's an interesting subject to delve on as i have experimented layering fragrances such as Aventus with perfumo, wow!

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2019
review_body:
I was led to this fragrance through a circuitous route. I was listening to the Dan Le Batard podcast, which made mention of Creed Aventus. From there I went to a store and smelled Creed Aventus from a small decant, but decided it was just a little too indulgent for casual spending (especially since I don't wear cologne often). I settled on getting Al Haramain L'Aventure Eau de Parfum. While the 100ml was similar in cost to the "real" tiny decant, I just didn't like the value prospect of the authentic item.

As others have mentioned, the Al Haramain packaging is pretty nice. I'm largely unmoved by that, though, so I just look at it as a cost component that doesn't really add any value (YMMV). As for the scent, I purchased it without smelling it. Upon the item arriving, I quickly tried it out. My first impression was that it was about a 6/10 match. Once it "settled" (about 15 minutes after applying), it was about a 7/10 match. It seems to last about 2-3 hours, at least at the relatively conservative amount I put on.

This was my first experience with copycat/homage type scent. Honestly, I think I expected it to be a closer copy, but it's pretty nice in its own right. Would anyone confuse the two? It's hard to say, but I do think that the staying power of the cologne is a little disappointing. It's good for a dinner, but it's not going to last a long night. YMMV.

reviewer_title: Worst Cologne I‚Äôve Ever Owned In Every Possible Way
review_body: I bought this cologne because of reviews and recommendations from online sources and the reviews herein. My expectations really weren‚Äôt high given the price-point, but this cologne didn‚Äôt even come close to meeting my LOWEST expectations. This is by far the worst cologne that I‚Äôve ever owned. The scent, when first sprayed smells like a lemon-scented cleaning agent. I don‚Äôt meant it smells like a clean lemony scent. I mean it smells like a lemon-scented cleaner. As for longevity, there is none. I‚Äôm not just saying that this aroma isn‚Äôt to my liking. It isn‚Äôt, but I wouldn‚Äôt leave a negative rating for a cologne on that basis alone. Doing so wouldn‚Äôt be fair because everyone‚Äôs taste is different. However, the aroma, layers, longevity and overall performance is terrible. If I could leave negative stars, I would.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2018
review_body:
I purchased this cologne solely based on reviews. I never got to smell it until it arrived at my door. At first I thought the scent to be a little strong and was scared to show my wife, she has a sense of smell as good as a bloodhound, and hates all the colognes I pick so I usually need pre approval. (I took a chance and ordered without telling her.)

I decided to wear it to work since she is asleep when I leave in the morning. When I got home after the first day wearing it, I gave her a hug and kiss, she asked what kind of cologne I was wearing. That made me nervous.

I told her it‚Äôs new, and to my surprise she loves it. The smell is not overpowering but it is strong and lasts all day. I also purchased Club de Nuit Intense based on reviews, it has a similar smell. Not nearly as good of a cologne as L‚ÄôAventure.

This cologne is the best cologne I‚Äôve worn since Acqua di Gio. And is now my absolute favorite! I get compliments on it everyday.

Just buy it, you won‚Äôt regret it.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2019
reviewer_title: No idea what Aventus is but the scent is nice - with one major flaw
review_body:
Pre review:
After reading and watching lot of reviews parfumo/youtube... I set out to find the scent and try it out (to no avail). So I took it at face value and ordered blindly (never doing that again).
Review:
So I decided to try it out on a casual evening. The scent is really nice, instantly felt the citrus and was loving it. 20 or so minutes later I literally can't tell if I have any perfume on (my body spray - which is nothing special was more pronounced).
I brushed that off and decided to try it again a few days later. This time I was home the whole day and sprayed some on my inner wrist then started the stop watch on my phone.
25 minutes later and I can barely tell if I sprayed anything. I literally have to place my nose next to my skin (1cm or less) to find out where I sprayed.
The presentation is nice and yes the bottle is a fingerprint magnet(luckily I have really dry palms). The hinges on the box already showing signs of falling apart by the second use. Mine came with an extra sample which was a pleasant surprise.
I've given it two starts, 1 star for scent, 1 star for the free sample.
Rating for the perfume on its own, 0 stars.

P. S: I bought directly from Amazon not third party sellers to avoid any doubts. Only possible scenarios are:
1. I got a dud
2. Amazon sold me a fake
3. AL Harmain believe the hype and are now watering newer batches (majority of positive reviews are from 2017, 2018
BH: U 230818011604

TL;DR Nice scent, doesn't last long (20-30 mins max), presentation is good from afar, mine came with a free sample.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2018
reviewer_title: A good fragrance, just doesn't last very long
review_body:
The biggest thing I don't like about this is that the performance/projection (sillage) is poor. I'm not sure if it is because of a reformulation or not, but the fragrance turns into a skin scent very quickly.

The fragrance is good. It does smell like Aventus, this is true. I own both.

The packaging is great. Yes, your fingers smudge up the mirrored-finish as others have said, but it's quite beautiful.

With L'Aventure, the initial application smells of citrus and you think you may have the wrong fragrance. Fear not. As it dries, almost if by magic, it becomes very Aventus-like and 99.9% of people will not be able to tell the difference. However, it's not a total Aventus clone. Side-by-side, there are hints of pepper that Aventus does not have.

For formal events, wear the real Aventus. If the cost is too much, then pay for a 2 ML or higher size decant. You don't need to pay $300 for a full bottle, just buy a decant online from Amazon.

I recommend this fragrance as a good everyday niche fragrance that is Aventus-like enough.

review_body:
I have mixed feelings about this. It smells REALLY good. The presentation (box and bottle) are beautiful, so this would make a great gift. However, this stuff doesn't last long, at all. After 30 minutes, I kept sniffing where I sprayed, and could barely detect a scent. And this is with a generous 3-4 spritzes per area.

No doubt you'll want to utilize a portable atomizer, as you'll need to reapply this cologne throughout the day if you want it detected in any way after a short period of time. Love the smell, disappointed with its drydown strength. HTH.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2018
review_body: This smells very much like Creed Aventus hrough and through. From the opening notes through dry down the only difference I can objectively point to doing the left arm/right arm smell test is in intensity and longevity. L'Adventure is somehwta of a softer blend and just a tad sweeter, and when compared side by side half an hour after application it gets clobbered in scent strength by Aventus. After about two-two and half hours L'Adventure is very faint, while Aventus is still going strong. But to its credit, L'Aventure maintains its scent profile all the way, so you can safely compensate by re-applying it every 3 hours or so. For the price being sold, it is a great bargain.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2018
review_body:
Wow, just wow. Let me start by saying, i'm hard to please when it comes to fragrances. Most of them smell like hand soap or chemicals to me.

This is the BEST fragrance I have ever smelled. I wanted something that projects, but is soft on the nose. It makes me feel cozy, but I also feel manly wearing it. That's exactly what you should want.

It lasts a great 6 hours, people around will smell it, but you aren't going to fill the room, people don't want to smell you from across the room.

This is my new signature fragrance, and I don't have to break the bank to wear it everyday.

review_body: This perfume is definitely not for a sensitive nose. It smells like the rich old lady at church. I could smell this before I even opened the box. I don't understand how this perfume is classified as "femme" scent. This smells like it's suited more for a man/masculine presenting person. I wish I could return it. reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 28, 2021
review_body:
The rhought of buying foreign perfume has never crossed my mind. But after searching for perfume oils I came accross Arabic scented perfume oils.
My guilty pleasure is perfume and I love the stuff and keep them all in pristine condition.
I thought I'd give o e of the oils a go and I chose this one purely because I liked the bottle lol. And I have to say it smells beautiful and with it being an oil it lasted for most of the day. I will say its not a perfume that is suited for the younger generation but for anyone else its perfect and a great price.
I'm sure other perfumes by this brand will have a perfume that is suited to everyone's taste.

Try for yourself...this ones not expensive and there are others that are higher in price and lower. Hope this helps!

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2023
reviewer_title: Nice scent, but not quite the same
review_body:
In the late ‚Äò70s and early ‚Äò80s, Aliage was my go-to scent. I loved its tart, grassy smell. It was different from any other scent I‚Äôd tried. It was also quite strong, so I only used a little of it at a time.

I just received my bottle of the current Aliage. It has a light floral scent and I will enjoy wearing it, but it‚Äôs not the same as the original scent. And actually, that may not be a bad thing. People aren‚Äôt as into strong scents these days and some are allergic, so it‚Äôs probably just as well that this is a lighter scent. I still have fond memories of the original, though.

review_body: I've loved this cologne for years

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2023
review_body: I have used Aliage for years and love it. Cheaper through Amazon.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2022
reviewer_title: Only scent I've worn for almost 50 years!
review_body: I discovered Aliage when I was in college back in the early 1970's. Aliage has a very fresh, light scent with woodsy notes and floral tones. I cannot even guesstimate how many times through these many years I've had friends and complete strangers compliment me. It is my signature scent and I will never stray from using Aliage. Estee Lauder used to have gift packages with Aliage Dusting Powder, and a purse-sized spray. I'm very sorry Lauder stopped selling them quite a few years ago. I just wish I had a dollar for every compliment I have received through all these years! I've heard that Lauder has lightened the scent through the years. I think that may be true. I just know lots of other perfumes have come and gone, but Aliage, (thankfully), is still here!

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2023
reviewer_title: My favorite cologne from Estee Lauder, however, she no longer sells it! But Amazon does!
review_body: Has the same beautiful sporty smell. Have worn it since it came out in the 70's (yep I'm that old and it cost $12.50 for the same size bottle) and it is the scent that I am known for. Estee no longer sells it :-( so when I found out Amazon does I bought it right away. I wear this cologne for me. I love how it smells on me...it's like no other.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2023
review_body:
Bought this as gift for my mother that loved this in the 70‚Äôs. It smells like she remembers but commented more than once that it doesn‚Äôt last and has very little performance.
Just an FYI for you Est√©e Lauder lovers.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2022
review_body: I read the reviews, some good and some not so good. The main complaint was that it didn't smell like Aliage of old. Your body chemistry changes as you age, and no scent will smell the same on you as it did when you were 30 years younger. With that said, it starts out a bit strong and then settles into a lovely scent. I wore it 20 years ago, and though I remember it a bit differently, it did not disappoint. I love it!

review_body: I recently added this little pretty to my collection, and I'm so glad I did. To me, it is comfort in a bottle. Evokes feelings of being in the most comfy of lounge wear, wrapped in a handmade quilt, snuggled on the couch, binge watching a favorite series or a movie marathon. My only tiny complaint is that the sillage is extraordinarily poor, and my perfume-eating-skin turns this into a skin scent almost instantly. But it is so soothing and calming, I just keep the bottle close by and respray often. Thankfully this one is affordable enough that I don't mind. Highly recommend!

review_body: I was so happy to find this fragrance. I wore it in high school (80‚Äôs), it smells exactly the same as I remember. It‚Äôs a good price too. I saw a purse size bottle at CVS and it cost the same as this full-size perfume. I love musk and this one makes me feel yummy!

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2023
review_body: I wore this scent decades ago, although not often, so decided to give it a try again. Initially I think it smells like a stale perfume that makes me regret spraying it on my body/clothes. Then later I'll get a slight 'whiff' and it's almost pretty. I think 'hmm, maybe it's not so bad.' But there's NO longevity whatsoever. It's as though I didn't use it at all. It leads me to assume, then, that it's very diluted. Honestly I wish I could return it.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2019
review_body: Ok, let's get one thing straight. The low stars does not reflect on the seller. The low stars is because it isn't what I wanted. It's my fault. I didn't remember that to get that deep, sensual scent, you need to get the one that is more oil based! This one is "Eau De Toilette", which means it is water based. It is a much more diluted scent. I won't send it back because it was my oversight. It doesn't smell as yummy as the oil based version. It also doesn't last very long scent wise to me. Lesson learned! The hard way!

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2016
review_body: This product was received on time and well-protected in its packaging. I have used this perfume for several years and it remains my signature scent. and very, very light in the fragrance. I am sadly disappointed. I know that this happens in some fragrances. I will
buy it one more time. If still the same, I probably will have to change the fragrance. :(

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2020
reviewer_title: Yuck. Smells powdery, old lady-like and cheap
review_body: I was very disappointed in this. I bought it based on tons of great Amazon reviews and good reviews on perfume websites. I love perfumes with musk. This one is just yuck. It smells very powdery and is too mature smelling for my liking. It also smells cheap. Yes, I know it was inexpensive but there are ‚Äúcheap‚Äù perfumes out there that don‚Äôt smell so. As for longevity, I don‚Äôt know because I washed it off an hour after I applied it. Ugh. Is it giftable? I guess it may work for a mature woman in your life, your grandma or great grandma if you will be able to stand hugging her or being around her when she wears this scent. I‚Äôm surprised that this has so many great reviews. If you are looking for a good perfume with musk, my favorite is Clean Skin from Sephora. The only issue with the Clean Skin perfume is the longevity could be better. You can also find Clean Skin perfume on Amazon or on other perfume websites.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2022
reviewer_title: Not at all like the original of the 1970‚Äôs
review_body:
I know what this product is supposed to smell like. I wore it for years. This is NOT right. It either is old and the fragrance has gone bad OR they no longer make it like they used it. Either way, I am extremely disappointed that I can‚Äôt return it. Had I known that I would be stuck with an inferior product I never would have bought it.
I spend thousands a year with Amazon between myself and my business and I‚Äôm pretty ticked off right now.
Without a doubt, a warning should have popped up before my purchase went through saying that it was ineligible for return!!!
They may have lost a customer.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2020
review_body: I have been wearing it for 30 yrs. It is exceptional. The scent is light and fresh, smells like you just got out of the shower. Beautiful musk smell. I will always buy it.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2020
reviewer_title: Tainted or disgusting substitute for Musk by Alyssa Ashley EAU de Toilette Natural Spray
review_body:
This is not the Alyssa Ashley EAU de Toilette spray I have used for over 40 years!!!! This is a horrible smelling, disgusting substitute!!! It's disgracefully that this product was sent to me. I'm even concerned it was tainted in some way. One spray and I new it was not the same cologne I've used for over 40 years. To add insult to injury, I was not permitted to return it, nor do I know who the 3rd party supplier is.

Amazon you should vet your 3rd party suppliers a lot better. I have been receiving a lot of crap products lately, most of them from China. A very bad reflection on you Amazon. If this sort of thing keeps up I will no buy from Amazon again.

This negative review is not for the REAL Houbigant, Alyssa Ashly line of products that has been wonderful products, and that I have used for decades, but a negative review of this disgusting substitute!!!!
