reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2023
reviewer_title: More masculine than unisex, good staying power
review_body:
This is a large bottle of eau de toilette! There is a lot in here for the money, thus a good value if you like the scent.

The scent itself seemed overly masculine. I realize it is described at "unisex", but that was not how it smelled to me.

In the bottle, it is strong, manly scent. Out of the bottle and on my skin, it is still strong.

Once the scent dries down after about 15 minutes, the initial strong manly type scent is not as overwhelming, but it does not mesh well with my chemistry and I still find it too strong.

I do not get a sense of flowers, nor oriental, just a musk with a little bit of maybe citrus? Either way, not great on me, but if you like strong musky man cologne scents, then this may be good for you.

Staying power is typical of an eau de toilette - noticeable for about an hour, then it dies down and slightly lingers for another hour. It isn't perfume, but lasts as expected for what it is.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2023
review_body:
I love trying new scents especially things that are a bit outside of what I normally purchase, I have a little over 60 perfumes and I break them into tiers of "most used", "liked but not loved", and "to give away" and this perfume is definitely going in the tier of "most used" and I just got it today. I'm going to separate my review into sections to make it easy to gather information for your purchase if you choose to purchase it.

The perfume's scent:
When you first spray the perfume it comes out in a really fine even mist and immediately you smell fresh pine; it's woody and light and not overpowering but it definitely takes the lead in the fragrance. While drying it has a slight sweetness of florals mixed in that pairs perfectly and adds a feminine element to a normally masculine pine note that we predominately see in men's fragrances.
When it dries down on FABRIC it still smells fresh and pine-y, almost citrus-y but not quite, and the cinnamon note isn't very present at all, I thought it smelled nice but I wouldn't call this a fragrance for everyone, that I would wear as a gourmand/florals fragrance loving woman.
NOW for the cool part.
I was spraying it on the burlap bag the perfume arrives in and reviewing it and decided to spray it on my skin to see how it worked with my body chemistry and I was extremely surprised. On my skin when it dried down I got this warmer earthy note mixed with cinnamon. It's sweet and slightly spicy and reminds me of an amber scent but not quite there. The dry down on skin for me makes the pine note almost an afterthought as the sweet florals and warm cinnamon take over and the pine shifts into an earthy woody blend instead of a pine needle scent (think forest not holiday).

Now I think we're all aware of the fact that everyone has a body chemistry that is different and how it smells on me may not be how it smells on you, but I will use this and wear it until there's nothing left... and then I'll go buy another bottle. It's mature and sophisticated without being powdery or musky. The sillage (scent trail that lingers behind you) isn't overwhelming and it being from the Middle East means that the essential oils they put in their fragrances guarantee a long-lasting potent perfume. You can under spray and it'll last all day.

Packaging/Giftability: The perfume arrives bubble-wrapped and inside a burlap bag with a business card with a QR code on it. Upon scanning the code you're sent to a website that tells you more about the company which was created by a DOCTOR who tells her story of creating products that are focused on natural ingredients that are effective, safe, and gentle for the skin. The company is in Israel so most of the writing on the site is in Hebrew, but when I accessed the site on my laptop I changed the language to English. They offer skin and body care as well as other fragrances, candles, diffusers, and soaps. If you have a luxurious friend who loves fragrances this would be a safe bet but I might get a gift bag for the product to sit in. If you have an eco-friendly holistic friend I think they'd enjoy this too.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2023
reviewer_title: Heavy scent. Large bottle. More masculine
review_body:
Review for AMA LURRA Unisec Perfume.

The smell is hard to describe but you could say it's floral or woody and "dense". It's a strong smell so definitely do not spray too much. I'd characterize it more as a masculine perfume than a unisex one (of course, to each their own). Compared to other perfumes and cologne, this didn't have a standout "refined" smell to me but it does still smell fairly good overall.

Overall, very subjectively speaking, it's just alright.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2023
review_body:
This frag smells kind of strange - to me, I really like a lot of the fragrance, you can especially smell the cinnamon and it just smells so nice. But there's definitely a lot of synthetic and cheap smell in here as well, which is why I say strange, because despite smelling cheap, I kind of still really enjoy the smell. It lasted a long time for me, not super heavy but I could smell it off myself for 6-8 hours.

I think i'd recommend this to someone younger, as it overall smells youthful by smelling a bit cheap. But i'd suggest anyone whos interested in interesting frags give this a try at a good price.

It‚Äôs kind of hard to describe, but what I‚Äôve noticed so far is that it has an initially bolder and almost woody scent, but then I get some aroma of spice. After that, I pick up on some sweeter and lighter floral notes. I think it‚Äôs well balanced, but it‚Äôs not something you‚Äôd want to use and hope not to be noticed. It is fairly powerful, and the fragrance endures pretty well. The bottle comes WITHOUT a cap, but in a nice burlap drawstring bag. To me, this might make a nice Christmas gift, or a winter birthday gift. For some reason, it doesn‚Äôt scream ‚Äúsummertime‚Äù to me, but it may be more suited for a cold wintery day occasion.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2023
reviewer_title: Smells okay, but very strong! Missing top... Purposeful, or accidental? Crooked and looks cheap.
review_body:
This AMA LURRA A NATURAL TALE MAYIM Unisex Perfume for Women & Men is a perfume that leans a bit more to the masculine side, but smells okay. It is definitely one that you would want to spray and walk, not run into, as it is quite strong. I don't get the warm cinnamon notes, but more of a somewhat sharp citrus, along with some florals, and a bit of powderiness.
It arrives in a nice burlap bag, with the name on the front, and ribbon pull ties at the top. It's a nice touch and looks a bit rustic. The listing mentions a clean spray top, but it just looks odd. The neck of the spray top on the bottle I received is quite crooked. I'm not sure if the top being "clean" is purposeful, or an accident that they are trying to market as something new and innovative. It just looks unfinished, oddly shaped, and comes off as looking rather cheap.
The fragrance smells okay, if you go very easy with it, it lasts for most of the day, and comes in a good sized bottle. I don't like the fact that there is no top, as it looks like I just lost it somewhere. It is not a bottle that I would want to place on my perfume display shelf.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2023
review_body: Ama Lurra MAYIM Eau de Toilette spray fragrance is one of those fragrances that probably smells different and unique on everyone. I took a chance on it because a heavy floral scent can give me a migraine, but I was drawn to the idea of cinnamon and pine. Happily, I got no headache from it. When I first sprayed lightly, my first impression was that it was too masculine. However, when it dried down and reacted with my body chemistry warmer notes came through and I find it to be a very inviting fragrance. That makes me very curious as to how this would smell on a man. It‚Äôs hard for me to pick up the cinnamon perhaps because it is mixed with pine. This could be too heavy a scent if not worn somewhat sparingly. And it does last the entire day. In that respect it‚Äôs more like a perfume than an eau de toilette. I am really going to enjoy this as a winter fragrance because of the warmer notes. I think the lack of a cap and the burlap pouch gives it a deliberately unfinished bohemian vibe. I also think it could make a cool couples gift. Highly recommend this unique fragrance.

review_body: This designer perfume lasted me almost 24 hours when I put it on. I can see this fragrance working as a unisex fragrance as many of the notes are gender neutral. review_body: This is my very favorite scent. I've used only Amarige for 23 years! I know this scent like no other. I would spray a small amount on the top of my head, and, sometimes, I would also spray a small amount on my neck. Not because the scent is too strong but because it lasted so long. If you touched your hair 2-3 days later, your hand would have this wonderful scent on it. I tried using about the same amount and noticed, right away, that something was different! I could barely smell that wonderful scent. I decided to spray a little more on my hair the next day and got the same result - a faint scent on my hands after stroking my clean hair. I don't know why this is so but I know this scent well enough to know that they changed something.

review_body: I suppose it's very 'giftable' though I rarely buy perfume and when I do - it's for myself. I try other perfumes (sample sizes) but I don't know why because this is my ONE TRUE scent. The floral bouquet, very intense and luscious, is created of mimosa, neroli, tuberose, gardenia and acacia with a gourmand hint of black currant. The warm woody base is composed of musk, sandalwood, vanilla, amber, Tonka bean and cedar. The perfume was created by Dominique Ropion in 1991. I HATE floral perfumes but the WOODY scents of sandalwood, cedar and amber really pop for me.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2020
reviewer_title: Too expensive for such little product...
review_body: I really like this scent, it has nodes of vanilla and obviously rose. It kinda gives a vintage nostalgia scent, like a hippie would wear it but also like a millionaire would wear it. The spray doesn't last long, you have to re-spray it every 25-30 minutes if you want to keep its full scent. The biggest downside to this product is that it is such a little bottle for such a "high" price. And yes I know it's a philosophy scent and the brand is expensive anyhow, but this is a different scenario. The whole bottle including the top is only about the size of a burts bees chapstick, and because of the curve in the bottle the product is only about the size of sample sizes of perfumes you can get at Sephora. Besides the price, I would highly recommend this product to any age group.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2023
reviewer_title: Al Haramain ~ Amber Oud, Carbon Edition ‚âà An, old~man scented, clone of, Creed, Green Irish Tweed.
review_body:
üó®Ô∏èMy, reviews/opinions ‚âà truthfully and honestly, assessed, through my knowledge and experience, with, this fragrance.

üëÉüèΩScent ‚âà A decent scent. Just isn't for me. To me, the opening is, analogous to, Davidoff ~ Cool Water. The mid is, somewhat consonant to, Creed ~ Green Irish Tweed‚Äôs mid. But... The dry down is, reminiscent, of a church, and/or, old~man smell.

ü¶æPerformance ‚âà As an, {EdP}, it's powerful, as expected. Decent sillage. The, atomizer/sprayer, is pressurized, and, works really well.

üí®Projection ‚âà About arms length. Or, maybe... 6~8 ft. radius.

‚è±Ô∏èLongevity ‚âà Full~Time job @ 8~10 hrs. on my skin. Overtime of, 12+ hrs. on, clothes.

üåÑ VersatilityüåÉ ‚âà I.M.O... I believe, anyone can wear any, fragrance, they want to... whenever, wherever, and for, whatever. But... In retrospect, I would say, whenever you want to smell like an, old~man, or, the inside of a, church.

üíµPrice/Valueüè∑Ô∏è ‚âà Exorbitantly overpriced. Especially... for a, 2.0 oz. bottle, of this type of, scented fragrance. Now... As far as, the value of the product, and/or, presentation of, A.H.A.O.C.E. I'd say, the price is somewhat fair.

üì¶Product ‚âà Very nice. The bottle of fragrance, is embedded snuggly, into a, submergered, outline of the bottle, on the inside of the box. Of which... The box is a, gray~ish, wooden box, that, lifts open. On the lid of the box is a, metal, carbon printed, plate. With... The name printed, onto, the metal plate. The bottom of the box, as well as, the Inside of the box, are both lined with, black felt. The bottle is, glass, that, is see through on the, sides and back. With... A metal, carbon printed, plate, on the front of the bottle. As of which, at the bottom of the plate, the name, is printed onto. The bottle has a, metal cap, that, instead of printed, has the name embossed, into, the top of the cap. Which... Snaps tightly, into place. Also, the bottle has a pressurized, atomizer/sprayer, that works really well.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2023
review_body:
I'm disappointed because I do love this scent but it doesn't last long enough for me to get through all the notes. It was a blind buy because I saw a video where a reviewer talked about the "powdery-vanilla" vibe that I love. By the way, I don't get ANY of the "Guaiac wood, White Musk, Jasmine, & Nagarmotha" shown on the product page and Fragrantica has a much better description of the scent accords.

My immediate impression is that there is a burst of sweet musky powder with a tiny hint of cashmere (???). Then it's gone before I get a chance to notice any bergamot, orange, or more than the tiniest note of pear. I guess this will end up being a hair scent for me.

I've seen other reviews online saying that this lasts & lasts so I think it's a body chemistry thing. And the bottle is heavy and very pretty in an understated way.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2022
reviewer_title: The sister-twin to my "Dior Homme Intense"....I LOVE IT!!!
review_body:
Oh...my....goodness!! I never thought I'd find a fragrance that I adore close to the way I feel about "Dior Homme Intense".
This "Ana Abiyedh" is a soft, pear-vanilla-musk combination that goes on smooth and lasts all day and all night. Next to my "Dior Homme Intense" it is one of the only fragrances I do not have to re-apply halfway through the day. It projects strongly for the first three hours, then settles down to an arm-length bubble of soft warm pear-vanilla heaven. If you've ever had pear ice cream, you will have an idea of what this fragrance smells/tastes like.
This fragrance is perfectly unisex due to the feminine softness of the vanilla and pear, and the masculine strength of the musk and woody notes. It's a perfect fruity-creamy-woody fragrance...and I've only found one other like it in my entire fragrance journey (Dior Homme Intense). The fact that Lataffa created this for such a great price only makes it more astounding!
This is truly love in a bottle...

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2023
review_body:
I always mention that I have a sensitive nose. Not in the way that scents overpower me, but in a way where I can identify ingredients in food as well as certain chemicals and if fruit or veggies are ripe.
The review: First off, the bottle y'all. It's so beautiful. It has gold, a teal color we see in vintage glass bottles. The cap has pearls and it swirls and it has bling. I never associate the bottle with the fragrance bc the bottle is supposed to be eye catching to the consumer, BUT, this one does very much describe the fragrance. It is very wispy, clean, crisp and sophisticatedly layered. I tried the scent on paper and then on my skin and got just slight variations of the smell.
The smell- It's crisp citrus right out of the bottle and then the floral- rose- seems to swirl into the citrus that reminds me of the shape of the cap. Then the playfulness of the clean citrus and feminine floral is met with sandalwood and a light oud. It seems to almost have a white musk or very very light powdery scent that softens the edges a bit- the oud I'm sure. There is a brown sugary/ caramel smell at base of it.
This scent is not at all sweet or as potent like other scents from the House of Lataffa. You might need to refresh this one or be more generous during application if you like it like its other house fragrances.
I do see this as being able to be used for both men and women. It is a smell that can be used by masculine presenting people. It does have a sultry aspect to it. It's fresh and clean but the base notes gives it a confidence and depth without taking the crisp and floral from it. I can see this being layered to make a scent cleaner and lighter.
For those that want a visualization of the smell- . This smell is casual walk through the citrus orchard that goes on to have a creamy dessert at an outdoor bistro table that ends in flirtatious seduction. You want some adventure and fun; you want to laugh but doors should definitely be opened for you. Or you should be doing the opening of the doors because this scent is complex but still very centered and put together.
So that is how it smells to me. I really enjoyed it and look forward to wearing it.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2023
review_body:
This perfume is so delicious, I‚Äôm very impressed. The opening is citrusy coming from sweet fruits such as mandarin/orange and the tasty bergamot, developing to a sweet jasmine which I love, and the dry down is sweet and woody with a bit of patchouli. It is not overwhelming, it is a very elegant scent. I think the projection is moderate the first 2-3 hours, then it lowers a bit but you can still smell yourself and others will, when they get close to you.
I highly recommend this frangance, it‚Äôs clean, it‚Äôs definitely unisex, it will make you feel sophisticated.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2023
review_body:
Oh my goodness, Andaleeb perfume is absolutely amazing! It has quickly become my go-to fragrance for everyday wear. The scent is a perfect blend of sweet and floral, with hints of musk and vanilla that make it so alluring and captivating.

I love how long-lasting the scent is, and how it lingers on my skin for hours after application. It's also not too overpowering, which is great because I can wear it to work or out with friends without worrying about it being too strong.

The packaging is also beautiful and elegant, making it a great gift option. I've received so many compliments on this perfume, and I always recommend it to anyone looking for a new scent to add to their collection.

Overall, I can't recommend Andaleeb perfume enough. It's the perfect scent for anyone who loves a sweet and floral fragrance that is long-lasting and not too overpowering. If you're looking for a new perfume to try, definitely give Andaleeb a chance - you won't be disappointed!

reviewer_title: Tiktok made me buy it but...
review_body:
I don't hate this product. In fact, my younger sister loves it. But that's my reason for rating a 3-star--the smell is very juvenile and smells cheap. The white musk notes are very potent and then there is just a hint of coconut. The other reviews have mentioned how it smells like summer in a bottle. It does, but it also smells cheap. In fact, I can always tell when someone is wearing it.

However, I do think this perfume makes a great layering contribution. I will layer this under sweeter musky perfumes and tropical scents (Clean Reserve Skin and even the Billy Eilish No 1 perfume). It works great with other perfumes in a similar scent family, but on its own, I am not a fan.

I was looking for something more beachy/salty/coconutty but this scent is still good, just not what I expected. GREAT size for the price, the packaging is cute and no damaged or expired parts/product. Willing to try the other scents!

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2022
reviewer_title: Smells amazing, just doesn‚Äôt last super long on my skin
review_body: I saw this product on TikTok for Sol de Janeiro dupe. It smells amazing, lasts much longer than the original and is a great price. The product does not last super long on my skin, but most perfumes don‚Äôt last too long on me. It does smell super similar to Sol de Janeiro, I honestly can‚Äôt tell the difference. If I smelt this and someone told me it was Sol de Janeiro, I would believe them.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2023
review_body:
Ladies. I screamed. DONT do it. Save yourself the time, energy and money. This smells like if you went to go visit your great Aunt Mertle at the convalescent home and she said ' hey sweetie, I've got something good for you in my purse, go grab it".
You walk over to her closet and look around. You dont see it, then you look down. Its sitting on the ground next to a box of moth balls.
You grab the purse, hand it over and she starts looking through it. She pulls out an apple from the last time she snagged from the fruit bar at pandarosa back in '98. "Ohhh, i forgot about that!"
Tosses it in the trash and continues to rummage through her bag. She then pulls out a yellow candy in a wrapper that looks a little sus. Is it...or excuse me...WAS IT...lemon or butterscotch? You'll never know.
'Here you go sweetie, just for you". You say thank you and shove that ish in your pocket, never to see the light of day again.

I couldn't wash this off fast enough. It's going back ASAP.

Nice to layer or wear alone. None offensive and I think it is a safe blind but. Would be great for any age. Safe for tweens as it won‚Äôt choke out the gym locker room as we did in the 90‚Äôs with our tribe aerosol and Malibu muskü§£

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2021
review_body: I love the smell of this perfume. It comes in a heavy glass bottle (even the lid has a little weight to it). My dad has breathing problems and a lot of perfumes choke him up so I have to be careful about what I wear and he hasn't had any problems with this perfume bothering him. I love that this perfume is vegan and free of parabens, phthalates, propylene glycol, gluten, & harsh dyes. It's a pale, pale yellow in color (I'm not sure why it looks honey colored in the pic). I've tried all of the anecdote perfumes and this 1 is my absolute favorite.

reviewer_title: I think it was meant to be and I am looking forward to a long relationship with my NBS ‚Äì New Best Scent ANGEL
review_body: A friend of mine introduced me to Angel via a pix. About a month later I went to a medical facility and I asked the nurse what she was wearing and she said, Angel. Later that day I ordered it. The day after I received it I went food shopping and someone was wearing it. I recognized the scent and struck up a long conversation with the woman who said she has been wearing Angel for 17 years. She told me to look in the box for an envelope!! What that I would have all these Angel encounters in such a short space of time? I think it was meant to be and I am looking forward to a long relationship with my NBS ‚Äì New Best Scent ANGEL!!

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2018
review_body: Enjoyed this for just one year and then the spray stopped working and the perfume discolored to a greyish blue. It still smells like Angel and I got many many compliments but basically it is a fake. When I took it to Macys to see if they could replace it for me, they told me that Mugler never made a bottle with this design/cap. And only now that I'm trying to open the cap to see why it won't spray do I realize that the top is sealed, so it's NOT a refillable bottle. All of the packaging and design looks like TM's and there's even a code inside the box. But, bottom line, it's a fake. Well, at least I got a year out of a $55 bottle when the real stuff sells for close to $150. Shame on you, Amazon for representing vendors who sell counterfeit materials. You need to do a better job of documenting your vendors!!

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2018
review_body:
I first purchased this (Angel 1.7 oz EDP spray) over a year ago and it came with a code you can register on the Mugler website. This time around, I purchased from the same listing, the Prime eligible one that is fulfilled by Amazon, hovering right around $50. Upon opening this box, however, there is a sticker with a barcode (no numbers) over the spot where the registration code would have been. I went to the website to see if they are doing some kind of barcode scanning registration now, but no, they are not; they still ask for the "unique code" which is 11 digits.

Ultimately I'm not sure if this means it is a fake or if the seller takes the codes out for whatever reason. I did compare this bottle to my previous (empty) bottle and they are exactly the same, with the only exception being a number printed on the back of the bottle just below the cap - they are two different numbers, but the font and color of the text is the same. This seems normal as it's possibly a unit number or batch number, who knows.

So far I have only just sprayed it once. The button you push to spray is a bit hard to press and sticks a little - it smells good, familiar, deep and kind of spicy, if that makes sense. It was very strong when I first sprayed it, but thankfully did not have the alcohol scent that you sometimes get with perfume. I'm not exactly a perfume connoisseur, but if there is any difference here in smell it is too minimal for me to notice. Then again, it has been a long time since I've worn this fragrance, so like I said, I can't be 100% certain.

I guess I knew going into this purchase that I was taking my chances. I figured that I had had a good result previously so I hoped I would again. While $50 is steep for a fake, it's a steal for a real (ha). I can't afford the full retail price in stores anyway, so whether it is real or fake, hopefully I can just convince myself that it is legit and enjoy it just the same.

If I notice anything odd going forward I'll update this review.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2013
review_body:
If you like the fragrance, it's great. If you don't, you'll hate it. My wife loved the smell of this on a friend of ours, and couldn't stop praising it. Neither of us are particularly enamored with most perfume, the majority of which I fond distracting (not in a good way) or just plain pungent. We sample-checked Angel when we passed through a dept. store a week or so after meeting with the aforementioned friend on a flying visit. With the wife's birthday imminent, and my reluctance to fork over the department store price, I placed an order here. I admit that I was somewhat wary, as it cost so much less from this seller than from the other sellers listed. My fears were allayed when the package arrived on her birthday (phew). It was the real thing, and I scored major 'good and thoughtful husband' points on this gift!
Tip: Go try it in a store to see if it works on you as well as it does on the person you smelled it on when you thought you liked it.
ANGEL is a sophisticated, light, unobtrusive fragrance, with lemony undertones. It mellows into it's fragrance pocket a minute or two after application.
*Make sure you get the one in the star-shaped bottle. The other (square/oblong) one is entirely different.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2018
reviewer_title: Concerns about authenticity of this product.
review_body:
I am pretty sure that the bottle that I received was counterfeit, despite buying directly from Amazon. I have been buying this perfume since it launched in 1992, and I am very familiar with the product.

I usually buy it in a local department store, but was happy to find it on here. I thought that buying from Amazon, and not a third party seller, would ensure authenticity, but that isn't the case.

The box that I received was wrapped in loose cellophane, sealed with a sticker. It was very easy to open without showing damage. The box looked authentic, but has all the bar codes cut out, and replaced with stickers, and the box itself has been cut open to remove the unique codes printed inside. Without those codes, the product can't be registered on the Mugler site.

The bottle looks close to authentic, but the sprayer on top is cheaply made and doesn't line up properly. My authentic bottles purchased directly from Mugler or from a Clarins counter have all had sturdy, cleanly former sprayers that lined up perfectly. The bottle does have an etched batch code, which matches the batch code on the box, but this code appears to be invalid. It doesn't match any batch made by Mugler/Clarins.

I did try a spray of the perfume, hoping for the best case scenario (the bottle was gray market, with identifying codes stripped so that they can't be traced to the original retailer). The perfume smelled sharper and more "green" than my authentic bottle purchased two months ago. The dry down was reasonably close to authentic, but it faded completely within two hours. I wear this perfume regularly, and the authentic EDP always lasts 8+ hours with my skin chemistry.

Worst case, it's counterfeit, possibly in reused packaging. Best case, it's gray market what was stored improperly and has suffered heat/age-related damage. I would not buy again.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2009
review_body: I've been wearing Angel for 14 years now. I get so many compliments on it. It works well for day or night. All it takes is one spray on the wrist, and then I rub it on my neck and chest. The fragrance lasts all day long. This product is completely authentic, not unlike other products you might buy from online discounters. I am very pleased with my amazon purchase and will be purchasing again. The one thing you should be sure to do before purchasing any perfume, go to an actual store and try it on first. Apply the perfume to your inner wrist, let it sit for at least 20 minutes, and then smell it. Each perfume will work differently with your body chemistry. What smells good in the bottle or on someone else, may smell horrible on you.

review_body:
Unless my wife has lost her sense of smell, this is the real thing. She loves it and will continue to come back for more. It smells lovely to me. I recognize the odor going back many years.
If you're buying it as a "blind" purchase you're being foolish. Buy your first bottle in a store where you can sample.
I don't doubt that an occasional purchase results in a spoiled, mishandled, or improperly stored product. But, let's get a grip. If you're neurotic and will doubt the wisdom of an online purchase, shop locally. Otherwise, this is certainly worth the savings and hopefully, if you get unlucky, you can return it for refund or replacement.

Before I was introduced to Angel I never wore any scent. My friend from England got me hooked on it.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2011
review_body:
Thierry Mugler's Angel came highly recommended to me by both a Male and a Female friend so I decided to order it without ever even trying it when I saw the Refill bottle here at such a low price.
I am very happy with my choice.
Angel is soft and feminine with notes of chocolate desserts and sandalwood along side a powdery finish that lingers. It lasts all day, but is not over powering (as long as you don't bathe in it).
I find myself sniffing my own wrist again and again to enjoy it's sweet smell.
The deeper notes in Angel make its more suited for nighttime in the Summer, or anytime wear for Fall or Winter.

I have been searching for a new "signature fragrance" and I believe I have found it in Angel.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2014
reviewer_title: Do you like notes of chocolate?!
review_body:
Me and my wife were reminiscing about colognes and perfumes from years past and I found out that one of her old favorites was also one that I loved smelling. Angel is the scent. It is a very rich scent filled with hints of chocolate. I think it smells really sensual on my wife, more importantly, she loves it. It is surely a beautiful smell but I would recommend that you sample it in person because the chocolate notes may not be to your taste. But if you want to expand your perfume repertoire then this is surely a step in the right direction.

Pros: Beautiful & unique scent, along with a very unique perfume bottle.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2011
reviewer_title: Awaiting a response for a refund
review_body:
5:53pm August 22, 2011

WOW!!! Here's the response I received from DEAD SEA BEAUTY regarding my request to obtain a refund from them:

Dear Customer,

Thank you for the email. From the comment we can see this item has been used, is that correct? Please know that only brand new, unused, and unwrapped items may be returned. Please know you received the correct spray and it does not in any way smell in a negative manner. It is the original perfume and it is not defective in any way. Any claims that it smells like "bug spray" are absurd. As per our return policy, used items may not be returned or exchanged. We are very sorry but since the item has been used, we are unable to issue a refund. Thank you.

SO IN OTHER WORDS...they do NOT stand behind their product! So how was I to smell the perfume, thorough the box?

I filed a claim with Amazon and will be contacting the Better Business Bureau. I know what this perfume is SUPPOSED to smell like, I have a bottle of it left over which I purchased in person at Macy's. This is VERY BAD business and I HIGHLY RECOMMEND people NOT to purchase anything from this BOGUS COMPANY.

I received the 1.7 oz bottle of Angel perfume. Mind you I still have some left over from the bottle I purchased from Macy's. Their (Dead Sea Beauty) bottle smells like BUG SPRAY! I had 3 other people smell my wrists. Left wrist with Macy's Angel perfume and right wrist with Dead Sea Beauty perfume and all 3 people agreed my right wrist smelled like bug spray.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2015
review_body:
I've always had a half trust for FRAGRANCENET, without having bought any of their merchandise.
Why, you ask?
Because of their great reputation, having loads of positive feedback and being Google trustworthy. I would often find myself by my computer on their website, looking at a world of discounted perfume. In awe at how much money I'd save.

Let me tell you: you get what you pay for. I received the so-called "Angel" perfume by Theirry Mugler from Fragrancenet.
It came in plastic wrapping, and what seemed like an authentic box. When I opened this box, things started to get sketchy. Supposedly with every Thierry Mugler perfume, you're supposed to receive a code printed on the upper inside portion of the box. This code was clearly cut out. Also what was the "Made in France" label on the side of the box was also cut out. Downright sketchy for nothing but a "100% authentic" perfume, Fragrancenet claims.
And while the bottle seemed to be proper in shape, the actual scent was awful. It smelled like a cheap, watery, and nauseating version of the actual Angel I've smelled in stores.
In stores it smelt fresher, spicier and softer. This one was just loud and made me want to barf.
While I couldn't return it, because it was "hazardous material", I was extremely dissatisfied with my purchase. Maybe this Angel perfume was just old or plain old fake. Will never buy from Fragrancenet again. Period.
Spend the extra $$$, it's well worth your time and money.

review_body:
I have been wearing this perfume for years and have ordered it from Amazon on more than one occasion with no problem. This time, however, was a different story. The perfume is not blue, as it is supposed to be, but is green and does not smell normal. Also, the original packaging appears to have been tampered with where the product is described. Either this is a knock off or the perfume is defective. This item is not able to be returned. Be wary when ordering this perfume!!!! I will not order perfume from Amazon again.
UPDATE 6/6/2017: Amazon customer service replaced the bottle and the new bottle I received was perfect and not counterfeit. The box did not appear to have been tampered with like in my original product. I will never order this product from Amazon again, but they did correct the situation.

review_body:
It just came today and I‚Äôm so happy. I initially discovered this scent through Scentbird subscription through the mail. After it was gone I kept the empty perfume just to smell it, I knew I had to get the big one. I‚Äôm not kidding you‚Ä¶.I‚Äôm married but when I am out and about I have had a handful of men at different times ask what perfume I had on. I just absolutely love it and cannot describe it. They put everything I like in this. I hope it lasts more than a few hours. I know the perfume lasts longer but I can‚Äôt find it anywhere. I just worked out, showered and I had to put a little on as I‚Äôm getting ready for bed. I LOVE THIS PERFUME.

Ok third update. It doesn‚Äôt have the 3 and it‚Äôs not the real deal. The other reviewers who said this is NOT authentic AND does not last for hours are CORRECT. It lasts 2 hours and as you could see from my bottle it doesn‚Äôt say 3.

Last update because the seller got back to me when I complained they didn‚Äôt send the 3. They said they (D&G) have changed the label. I don‚Äôt know if that is the truth or not but he sent a link. reviewer_title: Seems authentic...great smell...would be 5* for longer lasting power
review_body: I was very curious to the authenticity, especially since its half the cost of what's currently being sold at ulta. I even sent a message to the seller. I've never owned a store bought bottle, only smelled at ulta and sephora, but after spraying it on my skin in store and knowing it smelled good and worked with my body chemistry, I wanted to get it. It doesnt last the longest, but neither did the one that I sprayed on me in the store. It's a light summery scent with fruity undertones but also and expensive smelling vibe. For the price I can reapply. I even bought some travel atomizers that work great to keep in my purse and reapply. Would recommend. And I would buy again from this seller.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2012
review_body: I absolutely love this perfume. I'm yet to wear it for a full day but I just checked how it smells upon receiving it and I love it! I can absolutely imagine that this will become my new signature scent. It's so amazing that I seriously want to order 10 bottles just to keep stored away for when this one finishes. I am in love! :) It's definitely more of a fruity smell but it is sooooo fresh that it's not even a TINY bit overbearing. It is one of those scents that will not give you a headache at all, which in my case is rare because I am very sensitive to scents. I read somewhere that this compared to the smell of Garnier Fructis hair products and I have to say I definitely agree. So great! Another thing worth mentioning is that this bottle on amazon costs about fifty something dollars which MAY seem like a lot, however, in other places it runs for about sixty something. Despite the high cost, you definitely do get a lot of bang for your buck! Please give this a try if you love anything fresh and fruity! :D

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2013
review_body: I was very happy with this transaction as a whole. The price was better than buying this product from the mall (which is what I usually do). Shipping was fast. The product was exactly as I expected. For the past few years, this has been a fragrance that I can't do without. It's a soft, fruity (but mature & sophisticated scent). I will put emphasis on the fact that it does not make you smell like a little girl. D&G did a great job with this one. I've read that this line of fragrances is part of a group that can be worn by men or women. In my opinion, this one is strictly for the ladies. I wear it year-round because it smells that good. In the warmer months, I probably wear this scent 4 if not 5 days of the week. My only criticism would be that this scent does not last the whole day. I will re-apply mid-day. You really can't over do it. Having said that, I still give it 5 stars. For me, it's a must have fragrance.

I get migraines easily from overpowering perfumes & this one doesn‚Äôt have that affect on me so I‚Äôm very pleased with my purchase. I will definitely be recommending it to others & purchasing again!

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2013
review_body:
So, this is my first cologne review and purchase on Amazon. I'm not disappointed; I know a lot of people have received fake frags off Amazon. Lucky me, I got recieved an authentic one. So, before I review the cologne itself here's a few tips to know if yours is an authentic, first; instead of buying from other merchants buy it off Amazon itself instead, that way even if you got a fake, you can get a refund. Second, once you receive the cologne, there should be a code of numbers somewhere on the box and the cologne itself, mine is five numbers above the barcode yours could be different. If the number on the cologne matches with the box, congratulations you have an authentic frag. Third, go to checkcosmetic.net to check the shelf life, enter the code of the bottle or box in and it should tell you when it was manufactured. People usually say the average shelf life of a cologne is 3 years, if it's less than 3 years your cologne is not expired. I hope this helps.

So onto the cologne, my nose doesn't pick off the notes and I haven't "worn" it yet but I did a test spray on my arm. It smells great, it starts off as a fresh black oriental smell, keeping that mysterious black masculine feel to it but fresh then after maybe half an hour it changes to a sweet masculine smell, it doesn't overdo it in fact it lures you in; I guess that's where seduction comes in? Sillage depending on the areas you spray it could be average, to almost average. Keep in mind that I only sprayed once on my arm so it might be better on a different area or if you spray on multiple places. Longevity it's very good in that department, the scent lasted 8 hours with one spray on the arm. And even after I took a shower, there was still a very small lingering faint scent on my arm that I tested which the other I didn't spray did not have. All-in-all it's a good buy and I plan to purchase from Amazon again. Now, where would I use this cologne? I would say the ideal place or setting would be on a date, the lure this scent pulls off makes it ideal in a date situation. It's not a loud scent but if anyone gets close enough, they might be lured in by this frag. 4.8/5 due the sillage but since it might be because of one spray to the arm and the lure, I decided to give it a 5/5.

I remember I would walk by a female and they would aspire as they smell the cologne. Not anymore. The fragance goes away fast, and if you spray to much, you only will smell like alcahol. I used to spray 2 times on each side of the neck and it would last for hours. Something its different, is it a "fake", did they change the formula? Or they don't make it anymore, and what they are selling are just very old bottles(it is very cheap, but it wasn't like that) . I really like this cologne, hopefully I just got fake ones. I will try to find out what's going on. Currently using Eternity, which was Xmas gift, that cologne its very old too, but still smells very good, not my favorite, but 2 sprays on each side of the face does it....

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2012
reviewer_title: Very mild to put it mildly
review_body:
The reason i opted for this cologne in the first place was because i was searching for a replacement for Baryshnikov that got discontinued a few years ago for unexplainable reasons. The notes listed were some what similar to Baryshnikov's so i thought I'll give it a shot. Not only does it not smell like Baryshnikov, it doesn't smell like anything at all. Let me explain.

Don't get me wrong. I don't like strong smelling colognes and am all for subtlety when it comes to mens fragrances. However, i either got duped with a fake bottle or this thing is like water. It has very little to no smell and it evaporates within seconds. I haven't tried a tester at a store so i can't really compare the two but at the end of the day this thing was a waste of money for me.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2022
review_body: This Fragrance is nothing but warm Sugar or Gingerbread cookies upon the opening !! that Green Cardamom and vanilla is so prevalent upon the wet period it smells like you have your face in a hot bowl of soft warm sugar cookies !! I also am getting a very strong Almond/Nutmeg note that is not listed as a primary note but deff smells like its in there. I was definitely beyond surprised smelling this fragrance it was nothing that I expected. I expected fresh spicyness from the pink pepper and sweet from the citurs and bergamot but didnt get that at all. I have over 50 different Fragrances and this scent is definitely unique. longevity it not that good, im wearing it 4 hours now and i am struggling to smell it, i have to move around to get a good whiff. application was about 8-10 sprays so i deff put on more than enough. projection isnt that great as well. maybe this Fragrance will perform better in cooler air i will try that. its 85degrees out today. all in all i give this a 5 out of 10. for the 20$ price that it was im not dissatisfied with it ... Now, compared to Antonio Banderas' THE ICON ... that stuff is AMAZING !!! I'd pay $75.00 a bottle for that stuff and its only $3.00 more than The Secret Temptation.. one of the best Fragrances from the House of A.B. I have smelled so far. THE ICON is where its at, buy that 1 lol

review_body:
I call this the peace de resistance. Let me break it down for you.

This is a manly scent. Not fruity. Not wispy and not too weak/faint or strong or overpowering. The very first spray comes off strong but once it settles a bit, it goes to work.

This is the neck snapper, whiplash creator, chick magnet you should have in your collection.

reviewer_title: Smells great, well balanced, a total winner
review_body: I bought this one some 10 years ago, recommended by a girl I was dating at the time. She said she totally loved it (actually, she used some more colorful language lol). So I decided to give it a try, and loved it so much that I grabbed a second bottle for my father as a Christmas present. I bought another bottle for myself a few years later and I still have that one. It serves its purpose very well and it draws a lot of attention, I get asked frequently which parfum it it. It is not overpowering, and it is well balanced and fresh, yet very elegant. Something you could use for every occasion . The price is still great for what I can see. Definitely recommended as a part of any man's collection.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2023
review_body:
I liked Antonio Banderas Icon.
So I thoguht I would try out more of his fragrance line.
Well this one was a bummer. BIG disappointment.
First, the note breakdown says citrus, and it's got pineapple in the picture.
So I thought it would be a "lighter" more citrusy version of icon, which is a more spicy fragrance.
Nope. This one smells kind of like an old grandma.
I'm kind of exaggerating but, think of a HEAVY floral scent, that old women tend to overspray on themselves because their sense of smell is poor, so they overspray.
It smells like that. Very heavy floral scent.
Suffice to say this was a disappointment.
Now I don't know if I should bother getting other fragrance from the Banderas line.
Icon was good though.

review_body: The wormwood note is very intense and loud off my skin, has a very pleasant opening, citrus and cardamom style. Once it's dried down i smell very little other than wormwood and dirty vetiver note. Wormwood i would describe as a strong, rubbery, fungus (mushroom) like smell. It's different, i'll give them that! It's not nasty, just not my thing, i will however try it for a few days and i'll also layer it on itself to see if any other notes reveal themselves. EDIT: i don't wear this, the smell is not my thing, it can give off a vomit like smell also.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2023
review_body: I got these for my daughter for her birthday. She turned 11 and is getting into all the girly things. I searched lots of different brands, read tons of reviews and settled on this. I liked the price and the fact she‚Äôd have three different options. I figured there‚Äôd be at least one she liked. It comes in a nice package, and when she opened them and sprayed them, they all smell so good! She loves them! She has her favorite, but she likes them all. Heck, I do too. The sizes are great, you get your moneys worth and then some I think. Perfect for my baby girl, she is so excited to have her own perfume collection starting. I recommend these, I think they are great, nice quality, reasonably priced. She has always had extremely sensitive skin and I was concerned about getting something that would cause a rash/breakout/skin irritation but I am happy to say she‚Äôs had no problems which is a big deal. There are lots of products labeled for sensitive skin that she cannot even use. That is a huge plus! . These are a nice size to have one to keep in your car, purse, etc. and be assured you‚Äôll always smell good when out! Also I just wanted to say, I see many people writing about how the scent doesn‚Äôt last and just wanna add that after a while we cannot smell it on ourselves the way others can. My daughter uses one of these perfumes daily and I can smell her for a good long while, and the smell is on her clothes. So, the longevity of this product is not bad or unreasonable in my opinion. You‚Äôre just not smelling it on yourself anymore!

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2022
review_body: I've had eczema and dry skin all my life, but fortunately I've been able to control it mostly with moisturizers. However, as I've gotten older, heavier, and stiffer, it has become difficult to reach parts of my body. I've tried long handled sponges for regular moisturizer (hard to rub in well, leaves residue), even spray suntan lotion (concerns re: chemicals, I'm a cancer survivor), etc. Once I discovered this, I was excited! It works well, I use it on my back and legs (especially the backs) and it works well! I always make sure I have a bathroom rug under me when I do my legs so I don't get a slippery floor. I mostly use it at night and let it dry before I put on my night gown so it doesn't get on my clothes. Actually no staining on the night gowns, so it would probably be ok on regular clothes too. It's a good moisturizer and easy to use. For my back I just lean forward, spray the back from over my shoulders and let it settle. It's a little pricey but worth every penny to me.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2019
review_body: My body skin is so. dry. Year round. No matter what season. My fake tan I‚Äôm partial to makes it more dry! I‚Äôd read on a webpage about fake tan tips a spray lotion is great because it doesn‚Äôt create a lot of tan-fading friction and they reach alllll over (my back gets particularly dry!). I can reach my own back from years of fake tanning but I try to avoid the contortion needed if and whenever possible. This was the first spray lotion I received (popular competitor in a green spray bottle is coming my way too). Well I‚Äôm familiar with and partial to very heavy oils and lotions and this delivered BIG TIME! It isn‚Äôt AS heavy as the aquafor ointment of course, but for a 360 continuous aerosol spray this is very very emollient AND occlusive, meaning it hydrates super well and seals that moisture in! I love how it has lanolin, my favorite occlusive! I even use lanolin nursing moms‚Äô cream on my lips and my lips haven‚Äôt been dry in the 5 years I‚Äôve used it, not once! And I wear matte lips a lot. Anyway I‚Äôd never guess that an aerosol could be so greasy (for me that‚Äôs a compliment of the highest sort). I‚Äôm imagining the ‚Äúother‚Äù brand of spray lotion won‚Äôt be so thick. This stuff has saved my dry skin! You still gotta rub it in, but it spreads superrrr easily.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2021
reviewer_title: Stopped itchy winter skin on back! 10+ stars!
review_body: I would give 10 stars to this if I could. As I've gotten older, every winter, my back will itch constantly. This year has been particularly bad. My mom received a sample of this and gave it to me. I didn't hold out a lot of hope that it would provide any kind of lasting relief, but I tried it. From the first spray, the itching subsided quickly, and I only use it every other day now. As soon as I step out of the shower and dry off, I step back in and give my back a quick, light spray, and that's all it takes. How easy is that? I use so little that the shower floor doesn't get slick or coated. And a little amount is all it takes! It does leave a light coating on your skin, but it is so thin, that it won't stain your clothing. I am now itch-free 99% of the time, and I hope they never stop making this product!

If you spray it over carpet, you‚Äôre coating it with aquaphor too- yuck. The only real options is to stand on many towels I suppose.

review_body: Decently moisturizing, but made my skin feel so sticky and greasy for over a day afterward. The whole point fit me was to have a quick absorbing non-sticky moisturizer. It‚Äôs a no for me. Tried the Vaseline spray and it‚Äôs much more what I wanted.

review_body: We have eczema in our house and have aquaphor present at all times. Thought I would try this out to see if it was easier and it disappoints. Only got 4 stars because its still aquaphor and good product but it comes out foamy and cold and you still have to rub it in.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2020
review_body:
I bought this after my tattoo artist informed me that there was a spray version of Aquaphor. I have been using it twice daily for about a week now with my new tattoo, and it is so much faster and easier than rubbing in the regular stuff! It's easy to use on a large area, like the side of my calf. It goes on kind of wet at first, then it thickens a little like the normal consistency of Aquaphor. The only downside is you have to be careful where you spray it- it gets all over the floor (making anything non-carpet slippery!). I tried doing it over the tub thinking the excess fumes weren't enough to really hit the tub, but boy that made the tub like an ice skating rink. I just put a towel on the floor to catch any excess spray now.

Overall great for spray and go on new tattoos!

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2023
review_body: Not easy to use. Disappointed with product.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2023
review_body: Easy to spray hard to reach areas ! Light weight and doesn‚Äôt leave a greasy stain on clothes

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2022
review_body: My son has a lot of allergies and get aquaphor 3x a day. This isn't as messy and it is faster. I will by it again.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2022
review_body: I love this for my tattoos. Fresh ink needs moisture and now you don't have to rub the area you just spray! And it comes out cold so it feels really good on new ink. Will be buying more!

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2022
review_body: I have sun damage from tanning & sunburns. My skin is dry. AquaPhor is great used after shower before towelling off. Skin is soft and results lasts at least +\- 24hrs.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2022

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2022
review_body: I love the ointment so I decided to give the spray a try and I am in love all over again. It sprays on nice and feels great to dehydrated skin.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2021
review_body: I suffer from dry skin year-round, but the wintertime is especially brutal. Given that I'm single and not especially flexible, this has meant that my back is an itchy, rashy mess from November to March. This stuff is a LIFESAVER. Though the instructions say to rub the product in after spraying, it's really not necessary. I use this all over my body after showering and love how soft and moisturized it makes my skin feel without feeling heavy or greasy. I also love how little of it I need to use in comparison to traditional rub-on moisturizers. This relieved my itchiness after a single use and improved redness and bumps after two days. SO impressed with this product.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2020
reviewer_title: For those who cannot reach their backs!
review_body:
I have some issues and cannot reach my back, well I don't know anyone who can, except my flexible grandkids.
You know those places that going over the shoulders doesn't work, or reaching up from under your arms?? Those irritating places that nothing but a spaghetti server with fingers could scratch??
Well this winter my skin decided to be super dry and itchy, but now it's not.
I bend over slightly and spray away that dry skin after my showers, and then just put on jammies or a tshirt and let it soak in.
I spray my legs as well, it takes a lot of the pain away from my shoulders to be able to just spray it on.
WARNING
put down an old towel or something to collect the overspray it's pretty slippery!!!!!
I hope you'll try it, Oh and there is no scent.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2021
review_body: I got this after having a can of Vaseline lotion spray for a long time that I use solely for my back. I tried this as a replacement, but I found this to be pretty oily for a spray lotion - I'm sure it's great for super dry skin, but it was just too heavy for me and took quite a while to be absorbed.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2021
review_body: I have the softest skin ever because of this stuff. I am a big fan of aquaphor in almost any form in comes in. Ive been using it as a hand/foot cream because of all of the handwashing i do. When I found out this was a spray version i was very excited. I go through this quickly, however, its worth it to have moisturized skin. I put this on right after the shower before bed. This can feel thick/greasy....it is aquaphor after all! i wish the price point was slightly lower... but it wont stop me from repurchasing.

review_body: We‚Äôve always been an ‚Äòaquaphor family‚Äô since my daughter was born - shes always had super sensitive skin. Now that she‚Äôs on swim team (and in and out of the pool non-stop at home, too!), her skin gets so dry that she screams and cries while putting on even the gentlest of lotions. We‚Äôve defaulted to slathering aquaphor on her since it‚Äôs the only thing that doesn‚Äôt sting, but I‚Äôve never seen the spray before! We‚Äôll never go back to the pot ‚Äî this is SO EASY!

review_body: Guys this product is wonderful! I thought to myself no way can aerosol moisturizer moisturize my skin. It works just like the regular Aquaphor moisturizing products it coats, and you leave your skin feeling very silky soft. reviewer_title: Not as good as the jar!
review_body: This is a little lighter that the Aquaphor in a jar or tube. I was expecting even lighter. The number one ingredient in this spray is BUTANE. I know butane evaporates but it leaves a slight lingering scent. This is also a little greasier feeling than the jar. I like it but not as well as the jar.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2021
review_body: I can‚Äôt say enough words to tell you how fantastic this product is! I purchased for a tattoo I had just gotten at the request of my tattoo artist. I kept using this after the tattoo healed and have found that I reach for this instead of my lotion with a pump. It‚Äôs super easy to spray on, it works great for reaching your back and it‚Äôs a super moisturizer! The spray applies evenly and stays hydrated all day and I have super dry skin! I will keep purchasing this as my go to lotion!

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2021
review_body: I've had dry skin my entire life. I've tried lotions and creams with some relief but this product blows them all out of the water. It lasts all day, sometimes multiple days. It's easy to apply. I don't even rub it in. I just spray on the areas that are dry and the itching goes away. If you have had dry skin for a while, try it for a couple of days to see the full effect and allow your skin to heal.

review_body: Well this worked better than I hoped it would. My husband‚Äôs skin condition really requires more of an ointment type product than a lotion or cream. Seven years of trying dozens of different products, and then I discovered Aquaphor Ointment Body Spray. It couldn‚Äôt be easer to use and somehow the nozzle never clogs. And this ointment has really helped with my husband‚Äôs skin issue which requires a highly emollient product. Will never use anything else. I pray they never discontinue it.

This aquaphor spray lotion is the bomb diggity of all lotions. It's nice I can spray it on my back, after a shower and when I need to put it on my feet, I just spray and it instantly cools and sooths. No tears but huge sighs of relief!

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2022
review_body: good for me

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2020
review_body: I had high hopes after reading the reviews but I‚Äôm not liking the product as much. Like many have said, you have to cover the floor or else someone can seriously injure themselves by slipping. It also doesn‚Äôt spray evenly. The liquid is so thick it cakes up the nozzle and makes a mess. You have to have room to spray because it‚Äôs like petroleum and you may spray it on other things‚Äîyes, silly me for trying to rush and use this product before work. I spent more time cleaning up after the spray and it is supposed to make things easier. I rather take the time and lotion with my hands because you end up rubbing it in anyway. More importantly, it‚Äôs super cold! After taking a hot shower, the last thing I want to do is blast cold spray on my body! This product was a cool idea for a hot second. Over it.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2020
reviewer_title: Easy to use, cool concept, overall good moisturizer
review_body: The spray nozzle on this is super easy to use. It's not completely greasy hands free since you have to somewhat rub in the product and rub off excess from the can itself. Wasn't completely thrilled with the price but if you're suffering from dry skin and hate the idea of lathering lotions/creams on, this is for you. Definitely take into account where you are spraying since it can cause the floor around you to become slick!

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2022
review_body: I love and use Aquaphor Ointment daily for my dry skin and early stages of psoriasis. [my cuticles now like me better!] But there are spots we can't reach that need the same TLC, this works great!

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2021
reviewer_title: BE CAREFUL WHEN USING - SLIPPERY & COULD BE DANGEROUS
review_body: I gave this a one star rating, but a 5 star for moisturizing, a 5 star for value and a 4 star for being lightweight. So why the two star rating overall? Because this product can be potentially dangerous to use. How? You take out your can, you have just finished showering and you decide that the best place to spray will be in the shower, so as not to get the spray all over the bathroom floor. You spray and rub in and then commence to leaving the shower. And what happens? The shower floor is so slippery from the oil, that you practically break your neck. No matter WHERE you spray it inside, you set yourself up for the same danger. I even tried putting down a towel on the floor, but oil still sprayed further than I thought, especially when I was doing my legs, and then the TOWEL started slipping. So unless I am spraying outside on grass, which I likely would never, I will not be using this again. And heaven forbid that someone not familiar with it's oiliness, like a kid, uses it in the shower, thinking that it's a cool way to get moisturized. A disaster waiting to happen! There should be disclaimer on the can, as everyone doesn't think these things through: FOR USE ONLY ON AN ABSORBENT SURFACE THAT CANNOT SLIP

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2022
review_body: Aquaphor in a spray! What‚Äôs not to like? You can apply without getting your hands greasy, it‚Äôs great. The spray comes out kind of thick, so you may want to spread it around, but you don‚Äôt have to. Great for spraying on squirmy kids.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2022
review_body: Makes skin feel silky

This spray lotion saved me from peeling. It is easy to apply on my back by myself and has a cooling sensation. I'd apply it every few hours to get some relief from a sunburn. It doesn't smell great but you'll feel better fast.

Great to have on had when you're single and get dry skin on your back. haha

It doesn‚Äôt work that way because it still needs to be rubbed in. It also gets all over floors no matter how careful you are. Do yourself a favor and get the cheaper lotion application stick. reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2021

review_body: The spray not only cools and soothes dry skin, but you can apply it way more evenly and with a lot less mess. Yes, it cost more, but it took me a long time to go through a 3 OZ spray bottle so I know the 6 OZ will be awesome. And no extensive cleanup after application needed. Great product!

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2023
review_body: Ordered this product to save time but it really is a huge disappointment. It does moisturize and it does save time BUT the big can was empty in less than 2 weeks and because it‚Äôs a spray on, a lot of it gets wasted. You can feel it on the floor where you spray no matter how careful you are. The moisture is also very sticky and after using it for a week, I had some itchy bumps on my back. Also, I ordered two same sized canisters but received a big one and a little one (it isn‚Äôt returnable so Amazon refunded me for the cost of one). Bottom line, this isn‚Äôt worth what it costs and you are better off using regular lotion.

reviewer_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2020
reviewer_title: Not for every person but I can't live without it
review_body: I got this as a sample in an Ulta giftpack about 2 years ago. Since then, I buy them 2 at a time because I LOVE LOVE LOVE this product. I use it after I get out of the shower and the moisturizing effect last all day with no heavy feel. I have recommended this to other friends and they were lukewarm on it. The only thing that could make this better is if it smelled like sunshine and a tiny bit of tanning lotion:)
